Reviews.Title: “Nikko San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: HMK_09
Reviews.Content: Its location is that good.The #27 bus stop is 1 min walk and Union Square is 5 min walk from the hotel. The imperial club room is always clean and amenities are good enough to spend luxurious days. The price is relatively low considering its high quality. Things that I want to say are that it will be much better to have kids related amenities and breakfast should be more various.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BravoCharlie99
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nikko is located a short stroll from Union Square in San Francisco, thus perfectly positioned for a leisure visit to the city. Room was well-appointed, spacious and clean. Reception and concierge staff were very friendly, helpful and informative. Overall a very good hotel and I woul stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fs_rodriguez
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful time we had at the Nikko, perfect location, wonderful customer service, and beautiful decor, not to mention the indoor pool. What was really amazing is when we walked into their restaurant, Anzu at 930pm and requested a table for 6, not realizing they close at 10pm, and without hesitation fixed up a table for six, then to my embarrassment, 3 of us didn't show, but sat us anyway at the table. I immediately became aware of the time felt horrible, but instead they were so nice and said not to worry and didn't rush us. Awesome customer service. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Nikko SF”
Reviews.Author: Noriamura
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Nikko for the weekend to enjoy the city. What a wonderful hotel, friendly staff, helpful service and great location. The bellmen are also so nice and I enjoyed the Japanese breakfast very much from room service. This definitely is our go to hotel when staying in San Francisco because we also have such a wonderful experience each time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nikko delightful”
Reviews.Author: MWD376
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nikko, located just blocks from Union Square in San Francisco, is a delight. My visit to the hotel was for business, but the location gave me quick access to the city as a vacationer might like experience it. The front desk was polite and accommodating and friendly. Twice I turned to the concierge with a quick question. Both times they helped with professional knowledge and a smile. Morning room service was timely and tasty, with fresh fruit added without fee. Having Enterprise Car Rental directly at the building was a huge plus. Wifi should always come with the room. It is an absolute necessity for a business traveler, and should not be charged. Hotel Nikko does charge for WIFI. I would recommend Hotel Nikko to anyone wanting an excellent SF location, good service, and handsome accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale, central location”
Reviews.Author: widad11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nikko is located close to Union Square, shopping, and Powell Street cable car. The service and amenties are good. The rooms are spacious, and well-maintained. Wi-Fi is available in-room, but there is a charge. And beware opening the mini-bar. Charges appear even if you use nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but you pay everything you wanna use it”
Reviews.Author: Gustavo2207
Reviews.Content: I am brazilian and I booked my staying with you at a brazilian web site but before booking on it I enter at Nikkos Hotel website and I visited everything. The hotel is well located and the rooms are very nice, but I felt like I will always be charged by something I will use inside. When I arrived in front desk called Theresa said I just have a 1 king bed in my reservation and for a 2 double beds she would charge me U$20,00 extrta per night. I took my reservation and showed her I booked 2 double beds but she said she would need to charge me for 4 nights if I wanted a 2 double beds room. I said ok but I would want her a letter saying that my reserve was 1 king bed and not a 2 double beds room. When I said that, she said..hold on..I will check inside and after a couple minutes she came back saying my reservation was ok with 2 double beds. Well, I knew my reservation was for 2 double bed room. I showed her my receipt saying it was a 2 double beds and she just kept on saying she would need to charge me. After my request of the receipt she decided to check inside. I was double chocked because I dont know if the hotel always says to people they dont have what they booked just to charge an upgrade and because just after asking for a receipt that I would talk to the company who selled me me to check my reservation that than she decided to check inside if I was right. The 2nd thing is, after all this problem she said she could charge me for gym and swimming pool because it was not included on my reservation too. It my first experience at a hotel that I need to pay an extra rate for using a swimming pool and a gym. I use to travel a lot, I am Gold Member at Star Alliance and I use to stay at so many hotel around the world and this was the 1st time I see a hotel charging for gym and swimming pool at their own property. Beside that, the hotel charges U$15,00 for internet acess. In my country and many countries that I visited in the past, internet and facilities at the hotel are most of them included. Thats what I was complaining and I think it is not fair on paying.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bathrooms and POOR customer service”
Reviews.Author: daniel c
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying I NEVER write hotel reviews nor am I fussy over such little things that typically bothers most people. This should at least separate my review from other reviewers who just like to complain over nothing. BOOK ANOTHER HOTEL if you're thinking about considering this hotel, these positive reviews are misleading. Was here on business with some colleagues and stayed her for a night. Worst customer service and disgusting bathtubs.After a long night of work, I come back to my hotel room to take a shower so I can get to sleep and work the next morning. Long behold, disgusting hair in my bathtub among other things and on the bathroom floor. I called the operator several times to connect me to front desk, and at least 5 times, no answer. I go down to the front desk, no one there....a 1 star hotel would at least have someone to take care of this. I skip my shower, and immediately check out the next day along with my other 2 co-workers. I called customer service 2 days later, discuss with my issue, and they only offer to refund my internet service?! I ask to speak to a manager and the employee told me I would get an email or a phone call to follow. Of course I don't hear back and I had to email them several days later instead (anybody see their consistency with customer service yet?). I get a call finally and an email back saying they would refund only my gym pass/internet? I paid for a hotel room to sleep and use it's bathroom, it's not too hard to screw that up. I'm not asking for 5 star service, but at least a clean bathroom and some decent customer service. Not sure how this hotel got such good reviews, they must have hired a third party to provide all these positive reviews and I can't find it remotely possible that it truly reflects the quality of this hotel. I will be sure to let my company know to never allow any employee to ever stay at this hotel again or give them any business going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: Kshome
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great location and a staff that went out of their way to ensure a wonderful experience! Will return again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in Frisco!”
Reviews.Author: acook110774
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to be afforded the opportunity stay at Hotel Nikko in San Francisco. What an amazing place to stay for a work conference. And I must say, the bed was the most comfortable I have every slept in. Not to mention, the bathroom was so lush, spacious, and fantastic. If I get the chance to go back, I will definitely go back to Hotel Nikko!

Reviews.Title: “pricey but lovely room, miserable front desk service”
Reviews.Author: Sofiajclow
Reviews.Content: Took us a few rounds to finally found out where to drive up to the hotel front entrance and have to leave the car with a valet, instead of parking ourselves. Steeped parking cost per day at pricey $52 per day, (not including tipping the valet each time he brings our car up. So looking at over $62/- a day includiing tipping. Then the internet is like $15 a day!! considering its already a costly hotel, you would have thought internet is at least free. Thank god for the starbuck next to it, everyone seems to go in there for the free internet over a cup of coffee. A bottle of water is $6 from the fridge. Also upon check in, I was told my room is pretty small, maybe i would like to upgrade for $20++ per day extra, which i took, but again all money even before I check in. For the upgraded price, my room was spacious, clean, lovely bed, pillows, lovely bathroom. Front desk service sucks. I asked a few questions more then norm and they have this frown in their head and I can almost here 'Next please' shouting out to the person behind me. Location is good, easily accessible to shops, eateries and all. Will i go back again.. hell no unless for price i paid, we get if not complimentary breakfast, at least some mineral bottle of water or free internet! OH forgot to mentioned they nearly lose a parcel that was sent to me that I instructed was coming even before i flew out from UK. I nearly had a heart attack when they said it arrived on a msg to my room, when i went to reception, it took the reception 35mins and they cant find it. In the end i said, let me go in yr office to look, they let me in, and it was sittng right in front of the rest of the parcel!!! No proper communicatin btwn the biz center and the front desk!! Service with a smile ? Nope! as if telling me, move, next guy

Reviews.Title: “No Sleep for 20% Off”
Reviews.Author: Ramdar
Reviews.Content: The first night of our two day stay in a Junior Suite here last weekend was interrupted by a noisey HVAC unit (clicking sounds when the blower was off) and intermittent dings from what we at first thought was the elevator arriving on our floor. But when We woke up enough to remember we were too far down the corridor from the elevators to hearbthem we discovered the cause was the door bell on our room. It was going off on its own, sometimes just once, other times a dozen times in a row. It was 4::15 am and I called the front desk. A security guard and engineer eventually showed up, but doubted my explanation. Fortunately the door bell went on a ringing binge while they were still there. 45 minutes later they had silenced it and repaired the HVAC system. By at 5:30 am, getting back to sleep was not going to happen. Later that day the front desk manager promised to have the engineer recheck the system, but refused any billing adjustment. Moving to a different hotel was not a reasonable option, and our second night was clicking and dinging free. When checking out, the desk clerk begrudgingly gave us 20% off the first night only, saying that was the most the hotel did for any problems they caused. So if you don't mind not being able to sleep, you can get a 20% discount at the Nikko -- if you fight for it it. Me? I will never stay there again. I will pay full price elsewhere for a quiet night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient”
Reviews.Author: Piezer
Reviews.Content: Felt special but a little tired in places but if you can overlook that, it's awesome. The breakfast ( incl in our reservation) was terrific. Family friendly but not family overwhelmed! Located perfectly for all of the sites.

Reviews.Title: “great location in downtown area”
Reviews.Author: DTrad
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was great. The staff were super friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and quiet (the rug in the room was a bit soiled, but nothing major). The bedding looked new, and was clean. We couldnâ€™t hear our neighbours, but we could hear some ambulances in the area through the windows. There are a ton of great ethnic restaurants in the area (Colibri has fantastic Mexican food). If you like walking, the SFMOMA (on 3rd St) is a 15 minute walk from the hotel. The Asian Art Museum, near Civic Centre (Larkin Street) is also a 15 minute walk in the other direction. Note: there are LOTS of street people/ beggars in the area. There are also tons of shops nearby on Market Street. The Powel Street Station is the closest station to the hotel (5 minute walk up Mason to Oâ€™Farrell Street). To get to & from the airport by BART, it takes about 30-45 minutes (depending on the time of day). Just take the Richmond line into town; take the Millbrae direction out to the airport ($8.10 fare).

Reviews.Title: “really good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkruger
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel, but not the last. Had booked a comfort room, which includes free internet, fitnessaccess and free breakfast + better rooms with a fantastiv view of the skyline and the bay, which was well worth the extra money. The breakfast however was not that good and could have been replaced by a visit to the inhouse Starbucks. Location is fine, very very close ( 200 m) to union square.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: pinkirishangel
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and nice size room. Friendly staff. Great base for exploring San Fran! Get yummy diner breakfast in nearby Pinecrest Diner. Always busy, but quick and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfy Bed”
Reviews.Author: LeahBelle22
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Hotel Nikko and I enjoyed it as much as the first time I visited. The location is ideal as it is very close to Union Square. It is walking distance to the shopping center and great restaurants. The rooms are clean and the beds are really comfortable. While we were there we went to a show in the hotel (Rrazz Room) which is a great venue for live music. One downside - their standard rooms are extremely small. We upgraded to a larger room for a small fee.

Reviews.Title: “An Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Amanda J
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice, and think it's a great option for a stay in San Fran - whether for business or vacation. Located in downtown near Union Square, it offers a great starting point for exploring the city. I even walked to the piers and back one day, through Chinatown and North Beach... it was a great way to see some of the different San Fran neighborhoods! The fitness center and pool are also very nice and worth the money if you like to work out - make sure you check out the view from the pool patio. I would also suggest upgrading to the Imperial Club floors, as they offer a wine and cheese reception and free breakfast with awesome views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Bed and good location”
Reviews.Author: Globaltrading
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was great. It was so near to Union Square and Market Street. The room quite small but the bed was comfy. I stayed with a friend and we had to pay USD 40 to get Two double bed. It was also near to BART if you want to go to airport and some nearby cities. The cable car was also within proximity to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and facilities but hotel lacking charisma and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Ultraplur
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Nikko hotel in San Francisco in the past 10 years and I can say that the hotel still delivers a great location, unobstrusive service and very good hospitality in general. The affluence of asian visitors to the hotel is notable and so is the hotel's Japanese heritage. In everything from the hotel's restaurant (ANZU) and the room furnishings, you can sense the Japanese quality flair. The hotel, however, has not greatly evolved and under new management changes recently, probably should refresh very soon. Some details tell the age and lack of attention to detail quite dramatically, such as the torn (and sewn) drapers, the 1980's sound system and closet doors, for example. The experience sums up as positive in great part due to the prime location, a few steps away from Union Square, Market St and many other relevant places in town. This is the kind of hotel where service goes unnoticed and happens behind the scenes. You almost never bump into service people, however, service is conducted impeccably. The quality of the food is very good, but probably not the best Japanese/Asian that one can find in San Francisco, and of course that will always be a challenge in a city with so much Asian influence and so many gourmet alternatives. The hotel's fitness center and pool are a highlight and very good to excellent. The lobby lacks charisma and sense of belonging. It transmits the ethos of an empty office lobby or train station, not much to see, do or enjoy. It could have a vibrant bar scene if it wanted, but for some reason it is kept eerily empty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location- central to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Christelle C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as a recommendation from my coworker. I read alot of reviews about the boutique hotels in San Fran and personally I didn't want to run into issues with room temp, water not working, or dinginess. Hotel Nikko was beautiful. The rooms were comfortable (had a double) and the bathroom was actually really nice and big. Concierge outside was awesome in getting us taxis. The lounge, Anzu, was pretty cool... decent, kind of quiet when i went but I had a cucumber martini after a long day and it was great! The location was prime as the Powell St trolley is a block away, taxis everywhere, and the shops of Union Square are ALL around you. The cons is Union Square has alot of homeless people; they werent an issue but its sad to see so many. If you want to read my experience at San Fran and see pics of the places I visited and ate at please read my blog at www.smileclickkeep.blogspot.com. My Day 1 included North Beach, Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square, and more! Hope you found this helpful! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great family-friendly hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cashmyre
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Francisco with our three kids (13, 9, and 6) for five days over President's Day weekend, and Hotel Nikko was the perfect place for us to stay. I booked an Imperial Club Queen-Queen room via AAA, which is the best deal you'll get at this hotel. We had free daily breakfast and afternoon wine/snacks in the Club lounge, free Wi-Fi, free rollaway bed, and free access to the health club/pool for about $310/night (plus tax). The room was wonderful -- on the 23rd floor, in the corner, and very quiet. Roomy enough for a twin-bed rollaway to fit. The Club level rooms are bigger, which is one of the reasons we upgraded. The furnishings are contemporary and the colors are soothing; slate blue/white/dark wood/neutrals. All the usual stuff for a pretty nice hotel room: iHome alarm clock, flat-screen tv, double-layered light-blocking drapes, large bathroom with separate toilet room and shower/tub room. You can even watch tv on the bathroom mirror :) There was a complimentary fruit platter and large water bottle upon our arrival, and nightly turndown service includes little chocolates. Breakfast: You actually get a couple of breakfast choices; either the free Continental one in the Club lounge, or use the two daily passes for brunch at Anza, the restaurant downstairs. The first morning we all ate at Anza because we got to the Club lounge within 5 minutes of closing, and the guy was already putting everything away. Anza has an expansive, varied brunch buffet, which included Japanese-style breakfast items (e.g., miso soup, rice, etc.), as well as the usual American-style items. The brunch is normally $25pp, but my husband and I ate for free with our passes, and the kids' buffet was $10pp. Not too bad. The next few days my husband took the kids to the Club lounge for breakfast (they eat fast!), then brought them back to the room, where they watched a couple of cartoons while my husband and I went downstairs to Anza for the full brunch. Nice for us to get a little quiet time before a long busy day gets going, now that our 13 yr old can watch the younger ones for a bit! And you get two brunch buffet passes per night, per room, so you may as well use them. Pool: Very nice heated pool in a large, heated atrium. Kids loved it. The only problem is the VERY slippery tiles all around the pool area. Holy cow, I almost busted my head open! The kids were sliding around, too, whether barefoot or in flip-flops. Hotel Nikko, please upgrade/change those tiles soon, before someone really gets hurt! There is also a small Jacuzzi there, which I enjoyed. Lobby/atmosphere: The lobby is nice, the staff friendly, the place is high-end all around but not fussy; more modern. There is a Starbucks in the lobby; always a bonus! Location: We did not rent a car, so location was crucial, and this place was awesome. 1.5 blocks to the Powell St BART and cable car stop. MUNI stops everywhere. We only took a taxi once (other than the ride from/to OAK airport). Recommend: If you are going with kids, I highly recommend the CityPASS. What a deal! It just turned out that everything we wanted to do was part of the pass -- for some cities it is not that way at all. We made huge use of the unlimited MUNI (bus) rides and cable car rides. Would definitely stay here again, with or without the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nikko”
Reviews.Author: emcayman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. I stayed for business for 3 nights and 4 days. The rooms were well appointed and the bathroom was very nice. The rooms were cold and it took forever for it to warm up even with the thermostat at 75 degrees. I didn't get a chance to try out the restaurant but the room-service was good. The bar had seasonal drinks and provided us with a good place to chat and hash-out strategies in a lively environment. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “noisy lobby”
Reviews.Author: skitowin
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at Hotel Nikko. I like the location and service/value are good. The beds are comfortable, but the room we had was not large. The decor is modern and I like it, but the lobby was very noisy this visit. There was live music in the bar, and this echoed down the large tiled lobby, accentuating this effect. This distracted from my zen garden ideal...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sbenus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for a conference. The service was excellent and very friendly from the moment we checked in. The housekeeping service was done every day and left the room spotless. I bumped into a couple of housekeepers and they were extremely friendly as well. The decor of the hotel is very elegant but not stuffy and I liked it very much. I had a deluxe Queen room which was incredibly spacious. The bathroom was also quite roomy and had a glass shower as well as a full tub. I also enjoyed the large LCD TV. The bedding is very comfortable and the room had a view of O'Farrell street. Another plus is that it was literally 2 min. to get from the room to the conference center. The elevators were the quietest I have ever been in and were very fast. The hotel is also in a great location right in downtown San Francisco with plenty of great restaurants, bars, and shops within walking distance. I recommend checking out the Irish House Pub/Restaurant across the street. It has great food/drinks and a great ambiance. Not hotel related but the taxi situation in San Francisco is terrible. If possible, rent a car or use a service such as Uber. It might be more expensive but you'll save a lot of time and headache. Highly recommend this hotel and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “An Urban Oasis”
Reviews.Author: erbrown22
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Nikko and would definitely stay there again. I felt catered to and pampered from the moment I walked in to the door. The hotel is located in the Union Square neighborhood in San Francisco which is very close to Market Street and shopping in the area! The surrounding streets are busy and teeming with people, however, Hotel Nikko was literally like an escape! You walk in and the sound of a peaceful waterfall greets you immediately. The front desk staff were attentive and pleasant. The layout and decor of the hotel can suit a number of sensibilities from savvy business traveler to sophisticated urban weekender. The room I stayed in was spacious and extremely comfortable. I had to convince myself to get out of bed every morning :-) All in all, you will definitely enjoy your stay at this property. Besides the visual appeal and tranquil environment that is integrated throughout the hotel, the staff really aim to please and the level of service is more than exceptional. This way my first stay at a Hotel Nikko property and I definitely look forward to staying with them again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Service Extraordinaire!”
Reviews.Author: DirSalesMktg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Nikko while in San Franciso for a conference and had such a wonderful experience. The conference took place in the hotel's meeting rooms which were very beautiful. I had a great deal of contact with the Concierge, Housekeeping and Room Service associates as I took my breaks in my room and ordered Room Service a number of times. I found their employees to be the nicest, warmest people and enjoyed interacting with them. I should also mention that I had an email from the VP/GM shortly after my arrival welcoming me and offering a complimentary glass of wine with my meal in their restaurant. They clearly maintain high service standards. The kind and professional service made me feel at home while on business and missing family. My room was very nice and featured modern technology and stylish decor. I found the hotel to be extremely clean and well maintained. I felt safe and secure throughout my stay. There is so much to see and do within a short walk of the hotel and I took advantage of the abundance of great shops in the area. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and I will definitely be back. Many thanks to the team at Hotel Nikko!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay at Hoel Nikko San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nikko in San Francisco continues to excel in all areas. From the first encounter with the doormen upon arrival to the registration staff, everything is friendly, customer-focused and exceptional. There is nothing the Hotel Nikko staff cannot accomplish for the visitor and that focus on customer satisfaction makes the Hotel Nikko stand out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: AWal02
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through booking.com for this hotel. When we arrived reception staff informed us we had been upgraded to a city view room on a high floor. The hotel is in an ideal location for sightseeing stays. We had a fabulous stay a hotel nikko!

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: lin743
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in Hotel Nikko, upgraded to deluxe room which was fantastic, two queen sized beds. Comfortable beds and lovely linen, nice decor. Bathroom was spacious, very clean. The pool on the 5th floor was a pleasant temperature, although the shallow end being only 2'6 made it not really suitable for serious swimming. The jacuzzi was extreemly hot, on the point of being unbearable! Sauna and steam room were fine.Didn't use the gym but it looked as if you could have a fair workout there, all the usual equipment. Reception staff were efficient, friendly and helpful. As we did not have breakfast included in our rate the Starbucks adjacent to the hotel was ideal for the days we did not want a arterty clogging full american breakfast! And free wi-fi in Starbucks. The position of this hotel was ideal, no more than 5 minutes walk to Union Square, but not noisy at night. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Right-handed cups”
Reviews.Author: JamboTravel
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 nights in a Nikko club floor room. My room looked toward the bay/ financial district. There are many great things about the Nikko, and a few things preventing it from getting all 5's from me. Firstly the pluses. Wifi and breakfast is included with the club room; the wifi speed is good and the breakfast was excellent - some of the best scrambled eggs I've ever had. Service was efficient. One morning, one of the light bulbs failed when I turned the light on, and without me having to report it, it was fixed by the time I came back to my room later. The gym is well-equipped, though you pay a one-off $20 fee, and there's even a Starbucks on the ground floor. The bed is also very comfortable with a selection of pillows. The only downsides for me? Well, Although the room had a decent TV, there was an old stereo system with no iPod doc. There was a bedside clock radio, again very old, cheap and nasty with no iPod dock. They need to ditch these as it dates the room. Better to just get an ihome-type bedside unit and do away with the wall-mounted modular system. Also, the great view out of the window was somewhat spoiled by the window needing cleaning (outside). And the window blind had seen much better days. Finally and most annoying for me; the cups at breakfast have a swirly handle that sprout on one side and can only be used in your right hand. As a left hander, I found this very annoying. Every morning I had to request a "normal" cup with varying success. The staff just didn't understand why it was an issue. For a city which has come to stand for the rights of minority groups, I found it uncomfortable to be made to feel so abnormal by my simple request! Rant over. Other than that, thumbs up for the Nikko.

Reviews.Title: “Light, clean room, lovely breakfast...very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: DecafCapp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight for a family adventure in San Francisco. The room was a nice size for 4, big for SF standards. light, clean, quiet and the view was beautiful. Beds and linens were very comfortable. Bathroom was a nice size, very clean. Big towels and bathtub. Breakfast was included in our package, and the selection was impressive. They even have a Japanese-style breakfast as an option. Food and service were very good. Tons of restaurants and shops very close to the hotel. We parked down the street at the O'Farrell garage to avoid the very high parking cost at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Tranedan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Nikko on the back stretch of out week in San Fransico and we really liked it. Beds were great, rooms nice size and location was wonderful. Just a heads up. A block or two west is not a great location. Great breakfast places all around this place. A couple blocks from all mass transportation. Didn't realize we had to pay to use pool and sauna but was fairly inexpensive. Quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of a better place to stay while visiting San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: AaronPHX85015
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited San Francisco for a long get-away weekend. While planning the trip, we looked at various hotels in the downtown area. Having never stayed at the Hotel Nikko, we decided to try it out, based on the locationand the great nightly rate we found. It surpassed my expectations by far! It's a beautiful hotel in the perfect location to restaurants, Union Square, the MUNI and BART trains (public transportation that's only a couple blocks away), Chinatown, North Beach, and many other attractions. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, and the rooms were spacious, clean and very comfortable. Hotel Nikko will most likely be my new home away from home on future visits to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend getaway at Hotel Nikko in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Karen R
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Hotel Nikko in San Francisco. It is conveniently located near Union Square and shopping as well as fine dining. Room was well appointed and the king size bed was very comfortable. Staff were efficient and friendly. No waiting to check in. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nikko of SF - the best hotel in the west coast!!”
Reviews.Author: bhanu_murthy
Reviews.Content: I had my daughter's 9th birthday celebrated over at Nikko Hotel in San Francisco during Feb-2012. A total of 20 girls showed up from her 3rd grade class, and they thoroughly enjoyed their overnight stay at Nikko. The indoor pool was awesome, so were the staff. Originally I had reserved 4 rooms for the birthday event, and during check-in the front-desk lady had given me a free upgrade to Presidential suite!!! Kids really liked the spacious rooms and the views of Downtown/Bay from the suite. Thanks Nikko for making our stay memorable!! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if rate is right”
Reviews.Author: R L
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for two nights with a good rate. Very nice place to stay. Staff was incredibly helpful. Hotel is well-kept. Room was small but fine otherwise and quiet. Fitness center is a plus. I usually shop around and all things being equal this is a great spot, but not sure it's worth it if you pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Wekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Matthew J
Reviews.Content: I decided to take a quick getaway into the city for a belated Valentines present. I have been to The Rrazz Room at Nikko several times and figured why not stay in the hotel this time. Check in was very easy. No lines and the staff was very courteous, efficient and knowledgeable. Upon checking into our room, found it very comfortable. The only thing that I can say is there were some spots in the carpeting that needed to be cleaned as well as some black scuff marks on the back of the bathroom door that need to be removed. Things I wouldn't necessarily expect from a hotel of this caliber but nothing that would stop me from staying there again. We had tickets to go and see Cece Peniston (incredible performance). I decided to keep it all in the hotel for the most part. We ate their restaurant Anzu. Wonderful decor/ambiance, food was very fresh and service was great. Waiter/asst. waiter were very attentive without being intrusive. After dinner and before the show we enjoyed a cople of drinks in the bar. I really enjoyed the Ginger Drop. Pricing is about the same as you would see in other hotels and great drink. I love going to the Rrazz Room and have gone a few times to catch the performances. Never a bad seat in the house. Again the performance was powerful and energetic. We both enjoyed the weekend very much!

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Dick M
Reviews.Content: The hotel, two blocks from Union Square, is well situated. The rooms are a bit small. The highlight, however, was the very helpful concierge, who recommended everything from bus routes to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Genteel Comfort and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: DerekDonuts
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service, comfortable rooms, and convenient to downtown businesses and offices. Love the TV's in the bathrooms! Service in their restaurant if top-notch!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - not in Japan Town, but downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Frankee11
Reviews.Content: First of all, great pool. Great nightclub. Good food. Very nice rooms and service. Front desk could be a LITTLE more friendly but not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: NEvisitorfromCA
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location and impeccable service. Rooms were enormous and the bathroom was fit for royalty. Probably one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. Excellent accessibility to transportation, great restaurant in the hotel, and really a lovely experience for the City. The shower/tub separation is really nice, really a treat to stand under a rainfall showerhead at the end of a long day and relax.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect...just a few tweaks would do it!”
Reviews.Author: lkrocks
Reviews.Content: will start with the staff...loved them! from check in, to restaurant, cleaners wishing me good luck, and the bellman who found me a ride to the airport (great value) around the parade, the staff made our stay wonderful. the room is not big, but you can have a party in the bathroom...huge!!! loved tub and shower being separate, and the modern, high sink and counter space. furniture (desk chair, chair and ottoman, dresser, etc) were functional and that was much appreciated...so cool to have a recycling bin! safe was big enough for my 17" mac...which is not always the case at hotels. everything was clean, except a couple of spots on carpet and bed skirt...what would i do differently? a trash can in the room (along with recycle one), a make up mirror in bathroom, and if not too much to ask, a harder bed? bed was "ok" but both hubby and i thought it was sinking in the middle. finally, i would have loved some better choices of tv channels...yes, i know one does not travel to watch tv but lodgenet is definitely "male skewed"...every channel was sports or news. missed having some other options like lifetime, a+e, bravo etc. maybe it is a ploy to get you to buy movies? liked the choices of movies but sometimes a little tv is very comforting. overall would not hesitate to stay there again...enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nikko, a #1 Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: JonA1234
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Nikko Hotel three times. All three times were wonderful experiences. The rooms are very nice, clean and I feel high end.The staff is very pleasant and helpful. Location is one half block from Union Square. The metro is a block and a half to the south. That can get you most anywhere, the Port, Giants Stadium. I will be going back this spring with a stay at the Nikko and a Giants game. The Nikko is a must for a stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: Tripper099
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights on holiday on the Imperial Floor and overall the rooms and hotel itself were beautiful, in a modern, minimalist and functional style. What surprised me though was a lack of attention to detail from the staff, especially given the cost. Although they were friendly enough when approached (front desk, concierge, Anzu restaurant, Imperial Club Lounge), there was nothing outstanding or remarkable about the service. I didn't feel like the staff were there to please me (and definitely not trying to super-please me), rather just there to perform a function, i.e., very task oriented. The breakfast, which was included in the room rate, was very good, but the Sunday Brunch, which we booked for and paid for separately, was average at best, again, because nothing about it felt special - most of the food was either bland or boring (however the sushi assortment was the one standout), the wait staff were just getting through their jobs, and the DJ/live radio broadcast was somewhat of an interruption. Overall, disappointed that Nikko did not meet my expectations, and would not stay there again, other than maybe for a couple of nights' business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Our #2 Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: IceQueen2013
Reviews.Content: 2nd only to Mandarin Oriental. This was our 3rd stay at this hotel because we love its sustainable, clean lines, simple, modern (almost Dutch) design. Our rooms in all our stays were very modern and functional, spacious, with impressive view of the city. The beds were also very comfortable. Location cannot be beat -only a few steps to Union Square and Powell, the shopping hub of San Francisco. From this hotel, we walked everywhere, to the Metreon, to Westfield mall, even to OSHA on 2nd and 3rd St. (that is also our favorite Thai restaurant), and one time through Tenderloin district to get to AMC on O'Farrell (not a very good idea @ midnight). Starbucks at the lobby was the boyfriend's office on holiday while I wandered off in the city streets. We especially liked the embedded plasma TVs in the bathroom mirror. When plasma tv was still new back in 2009, we were like children excited about it as it was very unexpected. We also loved the fountain at the white marble lobby. This hotel's design highlights space quite a bit and will successfully impress you about that. Breakfast @ Anzu is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - would definitely return here”
Reviews.Author: pgreenld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights --- purchased the Nikko Floor Room with "free wireless internet" and full breakfast included. A great deal! The whole experience from start to finish was outstanding. Service, friendliness, room, bathroom, food, pool, fitness center, everything! Terrific location also. Only negative was that fitness center was an extra charge --- $20 for the stay for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect on an internet deal and great on any deal”
Reviews.Author: StubbornDiver
Reviews.Content: We booked the Nikko on an internet website for a good price and were delighted with the hotel. It is very high end, spotlessly clean, impressive and well managed. The location is great for Union Square although just a block or so away from Mason St., the environment gets a little edgy - generally harmless though. Staff were polite and efficient and with one small execption, a forgotten extra bath robe, service was great. We did not eat at the hotel as there are so many good eateries close by. The hotel restaurant menu looked elaborate but limited - again not a problem locally. Would we return? - for the right price, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “An affordable package for a nice hotel in SF??”
Reviews.Author: cadby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nikko for a two night getaway the week of Thanksgiving. They had an offer for an upgraded room, valet parking (usually $50+ in SF!), and buffet breakfast each morning. I believe it was $240 per night. The reception was efficient and pleasant, offering us an upgrade to a club level room for a nominal fee. We excepted as we were told that the Club Level lounge is open 24 hours for self-service coffee as well as the usual Continental breakfast and evening beer and wine. We went to the lounge after regular hours that evening for coffee and were disappointed to find nothing available. An email from the GM asking how our stay was that evening was replied to with this issue and she was very responsive correcting the problem and satisfying our needs. The room was comfortable, spacious and quiet. The bed was excellent with high quality linens. The Club level was the 27th floor, so that was a benefit of the upgrade as well. The included breakfast was at their restaurant Anzu. It was a very good quality buffet with a decent selection of freshly prepared traditional American and Japanese breakfast items. Our stay was excellent at the Nikko. The staff is lovely, the location fantastic, the value strong, and the food (at least breakfast) very good. Keep an eye on their package deals, as this one was a relative steal.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST location!”
Reviews.Author: Wildchild2538
Reviews.Content: Went for a week to SF, stayed at Hotel Nikko and loved it! It's walking distance to everything and let's not forget to mention the Starbuck's right next door :-))) The rooms were very nice and clean and the view was spectacular. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I can't say enough about this hotel. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff”
Reviews.Author: erin_george
Reviews.Content: My new favorite Union Square hotel. Book on their website for the best offers which include complimentary parking and internet. Staff is warm, friendly and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Rooms are comfortable and during both stays offered great views.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Haramkhor
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based purely on tripadvisor reviews. I had never heard of the Nikko brand before and i am used to staying at the Hilton due to my HHonours loyalty card but I gave it a go and found the service to be extremely good. The bell boys, reception staff and concierge all offered a smile during what was a busy time of the year. We spent new years eve and new years day at this hotel and stress levels would've been high but the staff certainly did not show it. We had a very nice lady at check in who offered us a deal. We were offered internet and one buffet breakfast for each of us (wife and I) for an extra charge of $30 p day which was decent since the internet charge on its own was $15 p day. What it did do however was bump us down from a deluxe king bed to a Queen which we weren't too thrilled about and although we did get a room on a reasonably high floor with a view, the bed was quite tiny. We were told that our deluxe King bed room would not include the internet and breakfast deal and we weren't promised a room with a view either so didn't really have a choice as such and we went ahead with the $30 p day deal. I think we might have paid a bit more initially to secure a deluxe king bed room so in hindsight from a purely economic/financial perspective, I don't think we really got an upgrade as such. However, besides that, our stay was wonderful. The mini bar is affordable. I found mini bars at some of our other hotels to be a bit more expensive than this one. The concierge was very helpful with restaurants. We wanted to see a bit of san francisco on New years day and they recommended two tour shuttle companies to us (I personally think the hotel might be earning a bit of commission on the sale of these tours) but I think the hop on hop off buses are good too if you want a bit more independence to decide what to do when. We used the hop on hop off buses in Chicago, and New York as well. The hotel is centrally located and so I probably would come back again however, if you are booking a king deluxe room, make sure you try and get one with a view otherwise the $30 internet and breakfast deal may lure you into downgrading to a queen like it did for us.

Reviews.Title: “good location, wide rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nammyoho
Reviews.Content: Location is really good, close to Powell Station, where you can easily get on the Cable. You can walk to Pier 39 in less than 40 minutes. The hotel is clean, has got really big rooms (my experience with my wife and four kids sharing two rooms was excellent). No noise at all. Very good Gym, SPA, and swimming pool (SPA is too hot...). Downstairs you can have your breakfast at Sturbucks...

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay, great staff”
Reviews.Author: 529WorldTraveler529
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. It continues to be welcoming, helpful, comfortable and the staff are extremely helpful and good.

Reviews.Title: “family stay - nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: houndgirl1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in April 2011 on a family road trip with myself, hubbie and 2 boys aged then 10 and 12. We had a nice stay here at the hotel - i will summarise as follows: Room: Stayed in a suite - they put in two single beds for the boys instead of a double sofa bed which was great Bathroom amazing - there was even a tv in the mirror, and a separate shower and tub TV's in both living area and bedroom - we had a slight hitch getting our TV to work but it was soon sorted out Comfy bed Safe in room Turn down service Pool: Shallow, but good for kids Not good for lap swimming though, as too shallow at shallow end really Gym was good - we didn't pay for access to pool or gym - not sure why as everyone else reviewing seemed to! restaurant: Ate in the bar area once in happy hour - we had wagyu beef burger sliders which were amazing location: starbucks attached to hotel (yay!) Valet parking is expensive, but we parked at a parking garage over the road which was quite a bit cheaper than parking at the hotel. Seemed to be safe and well run - we were happy taking the kids in there. cafe over the road does good muffins / breakfast very centrally located. easy to walk to union square and the trolley stop. However, there were a lot of homeless people about (some of them quite aggressively begging) so we didn't feel that comfortable walking around the area with the kids and took day trips away quite a bit after doing the "must see" san francisco sights. Burger king around the corner also looks like a homeless hangout. Shop over the road is quite expensive - we went further afield and found a Target to stock up. We enjoyed our stay at the Nikko - would recommend if you're with kids and want to stay in san francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation of Nikko Hotel, SF”
Reviews.Author: ivarper
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth and quick even though it was Dec. 25. We were upgraded to an Imperial Room which was very comfortable. The Christmas dinner was delicious as usual. Vastly superior to Hilton and other hotels in the center of SF. I have stayed at Nikko Hotel regularly for many, many years and the hotel has improved a lot the last the 5-10 years. Anzu resturant is excellent both for special occasion and quick stay-overs. New decorations have created a warmer atmosphere. I really feel welcome and I strongly, and I mean strong recommend this hotel to people who would like to stay away from Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor frontdesk attitude and management”
Reviews.Author: CKteng
Reviews.Content: First of all, I booked this hotel through priceline.com and I understand the booking through priceline usually good for only 2 persons. I have learnt this and I decided to call ahead (2 months prior to my stay) for an upgrade to double queen bedrooms to ensure it will be able to fit 4 of us. They asked for 30 dollars for the upgrade and I agreed with that. I confirmed with the hotel representative before i hung up just to make sure I got the upgrade. When i first checked in, the front desk lady told me they messed up my reservation and could not get me the bedroom i asked for, and agreed to give me a king bed (with $20 upgrade) and a roll-up bed with no additional charges. My friend and I agreed as we don't have any other options, especially during time around new year. On new year's eve, the hotel announced that they would require us to wear a wristband in order to get in to hotel after 10:30pm to protect our safety. In the morning, i went to frontdesk to claim my wristbands, and this lady (Pam or Pom) refused to give us more than 2 wristbands and claimed that we should pay additional $30 PER person for 5 nights, which will results in $300 additional charge. She was talking to me with a very bad attitude and no smile on her face at all. Four of us are students and i can tell she was looking down on us. With the same amount money we were paying I don't think we deserved that poor attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as good as others, such as Parc55 Hilton or the French one designed by Phillipe Starck.”
Reviews.Author: spenney
Reviews.Content: Instructions for mini bar in leaflet, there wasn't one. Tiny room for USA. No way of turning lights off when in bed ! No way of turning lights off exiting room. Bar closed in day so just expensive room service. Dusty on TV. Whole place soulless. Get in the Parc55 !!

Reviews.Title: “Union Sq Ideal”
Reviews.Author: danstrai
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 4 times. Location to Union Sq and the shopping area is ideal. Unfortunately at night there appears to be quite slot of begging outside the hotel. The Pool unfortunately is a negative but noyt a show stopper. But overall I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a city centre stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Misrepresentations, nickel and dime for everything, Japanese hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: hleighaz
Reviews.Content: Check in was terrible. Lost our requests for rooms near our friends, Ina co orating to requests even after speaking with Andy the manager. Cleanliness - floors in the rooms are filthy and look like they have not been shampooed in ages. Definitely due for a paint job as their are scuff marks on many of the walls. Health club and pool- they charge $20 a day to use the pool and did not disclose this when we reserved our room, or upon check in. The staff is not very helpful or considerate of the fact that a stay at their hotel is a vacation for their guests. Concierge gave bad directions. If this is a sign of japanese hospitality, count me out. Stay somewhere else as this hotel is not worthy of a 4 star and certainly is not a value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Littlesheep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Nikko Hotel from Dec. 23 to 27, 2011. I was looking forward to stay in this hotel after reading the good reviews on tripadvisor. As everyone says here, this hotel is in great location, close to Union Square and Cable car stop. Upon check-in, the hotel tried to sell us upgrade which we did not take. We travel quite often and usually other hotels provide free upgrade so we were surprised that Nikko tried to sell us upgrade. Our room was standard and acceptable size. There was no fridge in our room. There was one time that cleaning lady did not throw garbage and wash glasses. We ate at a restaurant in Nikko hotel. It was a relaxing atomsphere but nothing special. There are plenty of restaurants around the hotel so I would suggest to try other places.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: All23Ways
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2011 for a conference at the Moscone Center. I was very impressed with the quality of the finishes used here. The staff was very accommodating. I arrived 2 hours before checkin but was given a room immediately. The health club along with pool access was $10 extra per night but was well worth it. Location was perfect. 10min walk to Moscone Center, 10min to Chinatown. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Always comfortable and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Kirkm
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here over many years - and the consistent good service, nice rooms etc are one of the main reasons we keep going back. We always go for the imperial floor where internet and snacks are included. That somehow makes the high price bearable :-) Breakfast has a lot of Japanese items that most people will not want after a first try... so the breakfast is now looking weak compared to other buffets available. Plus only the adults staying get breakfast included in the rate we get. Free breakfast in the imperial floor is OK as the view is amazing. Fridge is annoying (auto-charge). Bathrooms fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location , beautiful interiors .. pricey though.”
Reviews.Author: Lee007_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in nikko hotel for 3 days. It was an excellent location for shopping, just walking distance, ranging from the high street shops to some of the moderate priced outlet malls. A lot of good restaurants to choose from aswell, just walking distance. The service was very friendly, i had a single room which was very spacious, including the bathroom. If i was to be very critical ... the day i checked in the towels weren't very clean, my fridge didn't open but no fret ... that could be replaced easily. The breakfast menu was expensive. There is a sunflower cafe right infront of the hotel which does very economical , and delicous breakfast menu's. And you have starbucks right below the hotel, very convenient. The lobby was very nice aswell . They have a business center but you have to pay even for making a copy which wasn't very nice. I haven't had to pay in other hotels. So, overall this is an expensive hotel... if you have no problem paying ... you can choose this one for. Dine out !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, must pay for everything however.”
Reviews.Author: panamanz
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the location very central. Concierge were helpful and organised a tour to muir woods easily. The room was on the small side and no fridge. Internet was outrageous 15 dollars a day and 10 dollars to use the gym! Front desk were abrupt and attempted to charge me for the gym even though I ddnt use it.

Reviews.Title: “It's a fine hotel, but I wouldn't go there expecting a super luxury experience.”
Reviews.Author: David St. Hubbins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference Mid-November 2011. For the price--$179 per night--it was fine, but if I was paying more, or on my own nickel, I'd be a little cranky. First, the positives: In person, all of the hotel staff were very pleasant and efficient. In general, the room was fine. Large by San Francisco standards, clean by any standard, with a view. Bed was comfy. As requested we were placed in a quiet room on a higher floor away from the elevators (although not away from the ice machine as we asked). Room service was efficient, priced reasonably, and tasty. The negatives: When you dealt with hotel staff not in person, things kind of fell apart. --Our wake-up call was an hour early--6:00 AM instead of 7:00 AM. That was kind of annoying. --The switches on a few of the lights didn't work, you'd have to twist them and twist them to get them to work--maybe. Left you kind of wondering if you twisting the wires inside the lights and creating a fire hazard. --The room had a flat screen tv, but either they don't get HD in the hotel or the tv was on the fritz. And the mini bar refrigerator didn't work. We called the front desk to look at the tv and fix the mini bar, but nothing ever happened. --They charged us five dollars for a mini bar drink we never had. --The clock radio had been set for 4:30 AM. And, of course, was impossible to decipher once it went off. It's a fine hotel, but I wouldn't go there expecting a super luxury experience.

Reviews.Title: “Zen oasis within a bustling city!”
Reviews.Author: Surilady
Reviews.Content: My first trip to SF and the 23 rd floor of Nikko made this a fantastic experience. The hotel is very clean, modern, and quiet. The wine and cheese afternoon and separate breakfast, gives you that special feeling. Staff is friendly and helpfull. Although after check- in you actually never see them,yet your room is clean, the bed is turned down and the music is on to welcome you when you get in at night. This is what makes the xperience so unique. Rooms are clean and spacious including the bathrooms, with both shower and separate bath, the mirror tv is also a nice touch. The hotel is central to both market street and union square, all in walking distance. Great restaurants around. Westfieldcenter, Bart, cable cars etc all within easy reach. Easy to go to pier 35, 39 and fishermans wharf, ghirardeli square etc. It is really busy around the hotel, full of people and activities, it feels safe. Do attend the shows in the rrazzroom, it is in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but watch out for internet fees!”
Reviews.Author: TRM215
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent one week in San Francisco, staying at the Hotel Nikko. It was our first trip to this beautiful city, so we decided to splurge to go with a fancier hotel. The location was superb, being very close to Union Square and all sorts of transportation. The hotel is beautiful, the staff was absolutely wonderful, the concierge staff were great. The only reason I don't rank it as a 5 star, Excellent, is that they charge $14.95 a day for internet access! I thought that was extremely high considering the cost per day that we paid for our week long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tight quarters for the price”
Reviews.Author: odot
Reviews.Content: I had really looked forward to staying at the Nikko -- especially having read some great reviews of it. Unfortunately, the rooms (I can only speak to the regular room that I was in, though it was supposed to be deluxe) was small. (My wife and I had to yield the traffic flow to each other to try to get around the bed and the desk.) It's also showing signs of wear. The fitness centre was OK (though the fact that they had a steam room and a sauna helped!!). The restaurant was great, with Japanese breakfast choices. I would not go back without a VERY special deal!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: n k
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great location for shopping, with Macy's, Niemen Marcus and Barney's New York just blocks away. The Wharf or the Piers are within a mile or two away. The hotel is sophisticated ad the rooms are very clean. I was very impressed with the upkeep of the room. The rooms are small but didn't bother us as we were out all days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: tuescon
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at hotel nikko. Room was on the 9th floor but didn't feel noisy. Room was very nice. Excellent bedding and pillows. Great location. Very close to where the action is. Starbucks right around the corner. Got a great package that included wifi and parking (prob due to thanksgiving week) so comparing this to Sofitel in LA where I just drove from, miles better and a lot cheaper! Only downside is prob the parking entrance as mentioned before. My GPS doesn't recognise the correct entrance so I always have to loop round. However, has to be one of the better hotels out there! Could recommend this place more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, reasonable weekend rates, near BART”
Reviews.Author: claymaryjo
Reviews.Content: We decided to fly from LA to San francisco went on line, and got some great rates at hotels. We narrowed down our search to those near the San Francisco BART stations, and picked the Nikko as we could roll our suitcases to the Nikko with not too much effort. Since we got an internet rate, we did have to pay a slight supplement under $10 per person to use gym facilities which had a pool, sauna, some treadmills, weights, and bicycles. The hotel itself is near public transportation, and the concierge explained the buses, cable cars, BART and electric trolleys to us which we used to navigate all over the city. I drive over 30,000 miles per year in my job, and was glad to give up driving in bumper to bumper traffic from San francisco airport. If you fly into Oakland, you can also use the Bart to go into San Francisco. The Science Museum, Ghiradhelli Square, the Embarcadero and Union Square are all easily accessed from the hotel by public transportation. One great place to eat Breakfast is just up the street, called Sears Fine Foods, an old time breakfast spot, but still has great food. There's also a couple of Starbucks within walking district of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TravelingProf47
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff was friendly, efficient and helpful. The room though smaller than those at a typical Marriott or Hilton was very clean and comfortable. There was a light over the desk so reading at night was not difficult. The New York Times (including the Sunday Times) was delivered to my door everyday without additional charge. The Nikko, like many hotels, has stopped automatically delivering newspapers to every room but it does so, if requested. The hotel has a restaurant in it but the restaurant does not feature the menu that appears on the room service menu. Since Nikko is a Japanese chain, I expected to be able to order a rice based meal in the restaurant. The restaurant did not have a single dish that included rice. But not to worry. There are many restaurants, bakeries and coffee shops all around the hotel. I enjoyed a Japanese meal at a restaurant in the next block. Large department stores such as Macy's are a couple of blocks away. The famous San Franciso trolley, the subway (called Bart), street cars and buses are all close by. It is easy to reach Fisherman's Warf and other tourist destinations without a car. I would certainly stay at the Nikko again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Japan-US-Fusion”
Reviews.Author: highmileclub
Reviews.Content: i heard the upper floors are going to be renovated by 2012. + friendly staff + good views from the rooms + centrally located at union square - pool area is a little dated but still ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, above average staff”
Reviews.Author: James_birduk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable, clean, has reasonable facilities, is in an excellent location, and has above average staff. As with a lot of hotels, pretty much everything is charged for, but this is I guess to be expected, though they do have free newspapers in the reception area. There is a Starbucks at lower lobby level which has free wifi. the pool is super shallow and would be great for children but is a bit too shallow for most adult swimmers, there is a one off $10 charge for use of the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Just barely fine”
Reviews.Author: wcoaster
Reviews.Content: Wear and stains on carpet. And why bother with a giant flat screen that has the most minimal non-HD tv? A joke. For the money there are MUCH better hotels in this neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, good overall deal.”
Reviews.Author: jckdaniels03
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on Priceline. Hotel is older but has been refurbished nicely. Bathroom was fantastic. Upon checking in, the hotel desk attendant offered a complimentary refridgerator for our daughter's food. Quick walk to Union Square, BART, and good restaurants. Hotel Nikko does border the Tenderloin so be careful walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, well located, nice service”
Reviews.Author: Lynn_mtl
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on business for a conference, so I cannot really comment on the price. But the room was very comfortable, quiet, all the comforts you need. The staff was very professional and helpful and the concierge gave us good tips on place to eat and things to see. There are many, many stores and restaurants just steps away, so if you arrive tired, you don't have to go far to get what you need. A very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: SeanM186605
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September at the start of a three week California/ Las Vegas trip and really enjoyed it. Staff were excellent, we arrived late on our first night and requested a mini-fridge for our room and also needed an adaptor as our phone chargers were European. This was no problem to them even late on a Saturday night. The room on the 23rd floor was very comfortable and clean and exactly what was needed after a long days sightseeing. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a modern,comfortable and centrally located hotel in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: JDK12345
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights while on a conference. Hotel is non-descript building in downtown, not too far from Union square. Not the prettiest location but close to major shopping and a short distance from the Moscone Convention Center (walkable, 10-15 minutes). Nice basic gym facilities, nice-looking restaurant on site although I can't comment on the food. I had one in-room breakfast which was hearty and tasty but horrendously overpriced, you can do just as good at one of the diners down the street. Starbucks conveniently located in lobby. My room was on a high floor, which is recommended due to the ambient noise. Don't think I heard any other guests while I was there. The place at times felt eerily quiet. My room was nice and large, plenty of space, excellent bathroom with great shower. Overall the place has a subdued, low-key, peaceful asian feel. Recommended for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable option in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: USGAB
Reviews.Content: The Nikko Hotel is a nice hotel in Union Sq. Area with an excellent situation (if you are the typical tourist). Youâ€™re in the center of San Francisco, therefore around the hotel is always crowed. The size of the room was OK and everything was clean. Something you should know: - There is a Starbucks in the lobby, however we didnâ€™t have breakfast because there was always a long line. - We didnâ€™t enjoy the swimming pool (in San Francisco you have always something to do), however they charge something to use it. ?? San Francisco is an expensive city, especially Union SQ. Luckily we found a nice rate in some web page.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: oliverhsg
Reviews.Content: Impeccably clean rooms, friendly service, excellent breakfast buffet, tasteful decor, central location. My stay was for pleasure, but I would highly recommend this hotel for business as well. I stayed in a standard queen room, which was small but well appointed and with a beautiful view from the 20th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Are clean rooms too much to ask?”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany B
Reviews.Content: For a fun girls trip a girlfriend and I headed down to the bay from Portland. We booked a double room at the Hotel Nikko for last weekend and I can say without a doubt worst hotel experience I have ever had. We arrived at 7:00pm only to be told they have given our room away and will have to share a queen size bed, (we are so beat from the trip we say thatâ€™s fine). When we get into the room we realize that the room hasnâ€™t been cleaned, the toilet is filthy, there are no clean towels and the bed spread has a suspicious stain on it. We call guest services to see if they can clean the room and instead, 20 minutes later they just send up a new comforter, and leave it on the bed telling us we can make it. We call back and ask them to at least clean the toilet and again 20 minutes later they send someone up and that person switchâ€™s us to an even smaller room. We are so exhausted from our drive we just say itâ€™s fine and we head out for dinner. When we get back to our new room we look at our sheets and realize these too are filthy. By that point we decide to sleep on top of the covers in our cloths because we are so tired of the run around. Exhausted and frustrated I can say this is not a hotel I would recommend to anyone, the service is terrible, checkout is early at 11:00am NO EXCEPTIONS, parking is $52, wifi is $15 and a clean bed is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance”
Reviews.Author: friendlyinsomniac
Reviews.Content: Nice understated hotel. Comfy beds, good location. There was quite a bit of street noise from my 9th floor room but I found that it quieted down after 10pm so it did not keep me awake. There is a large flat panel TV mounted to the well which helps keep the feel of the fairly large room. Huge luxururious bathroom with separate bath and shower fixtures. The lobby is white marble, a bit like a mausoleum but very tasteful. There is a Starbucks on the OFarrell side but it had extremely long lines and the baristas did not know what to do when I asked for decaf - better option is Barbary Coast Cafe a block down Cyril Magnin, they had a full pastry case with excellent muffins, serve breakfast sandwiches and 8 different kinds of drip coffee. Gym access is $10 extra, surprising considering the relatively high room rate though they did provide complimentary wifi. Video check out was in Japanese, I had to guess at what the screen was telling me and made a few few wrong choices before finally getting it right.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comparable to Hilton”
Reviews.Author: DOSF1984
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again. Perfect location, impressive ambience, very clean, great service. Bathroom was very nice with separate shower and tub which is unusual for the area. If you're expecting a large room, you might not find it here (or anywhere in San Fran for that matter). We upgraded from a Queen to a King for a reasonable $20/night and it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: Our trip was a week long (7 day), and we couldn't have asked for a better hotel. We stayed in the Executive Suite and it was very nice, with a great view of the City. Location is great (shopping, restaurants, transit, etc). Restaurant (Anzu) was also a nice touch. There is a Starbucks next to lobby making it nice for morning coffee and snacks. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “smooth”
Reviews.Author: Jacken
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hotel Nikko and were very happy with our experience there. The rooms on the Nikko floor are a good size and include free wi-fi which was very useful in planning daily activities. Everyone we encountered was very friendly and helpful. Anzu is a good restaurant, although not cheap, and the Rrazz Room is a good place to catch a show. The gym, pool, and sauna are spotless. The location is great for theatre and shopping. Overall, we would be happy to stay at the Nikko anytime we are in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nikko in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Jonathanendo613
Reviews.Content: We were extremely impressed with the Hotel Nikko. The room was lovely, and the service was exceptionally attentive. We used the pool and health club which were very nice. The buffet breakfast was excellent, and in the evening we took advantage of the Imperial lounge for pre-dinner snacks. The location was great for us, and we felt that the Hotel Nikko was a great value for staying in San Francisco. We will definitely stay there the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: given2fly
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean and great restaurant. Pool a little small. You should def have sushi and anzu! Very friendly staff. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: Potzerelli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on our honeymoon. Hotel is very clean. Check was effecient, however we received no upgrade or anything extra when we told the staff we were on our honeymoon. That was disappointing. The room we were given was very clean, but very small. However it was a great location, to go sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Short Break”
Reviews.Author: GASH80
Reviews.Content: I am in full agreement with other travellers, not too sure how the price compares with other similar hotels in the area, ours was part of a package deal from the UK. Overall the place is very smart and stylish the rooms likewise. Breakfast although at $30.00 in tax, pricey but excellent, you would have to go far to beat it. Good location, right by Union Square, so you can get the cable car out to the Wharf Area. Great Stay, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms. Large bathrooms. Excellent gym and heated pool Excellent central location.”
Reviews.Author: jadebynikolai
Reviews.Content: We had to wait 3 hours for our room. But the room is large and the bathroom also. Location is excellent. The gym and heated pool are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a meeting in SF”
Reviews.Author: ETinSLC
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed at this hotel for meetings and they did a great job with the rooms and service for the meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant stay at the Nikko”
Reviews.Author: hidalgoi
Reviews.Content: My family and I had the opportunity to visit SF this weekend. We had such a good time at the zoo and staying at the Nikko, which is convientenly located in the Union Square area. Great staff, they were very friendly and very welcoming. So much to do so little time. Would highly recommend the Hotel Nikko for the location, price and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kent M
Reviews.Content: The Nikko staff will make your experience great. I stay here often and they have yet to disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: RazNe
Reviews.Content: Very clean, good sized rooms with all necessary facilities. Service is excellent. Location is perfect for shopping, sightseeing or restaurants. We did not taste the hotel food at Ansu as there are so many options within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “A great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MurphyJulie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a long weekend at the Nikko. We had a great experience from the moment we checked in. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the concierge was outstanding. The room was on the 24th floor with a fantastic view of the city. It was one of the nicest hotel rooms we have ever stayed in. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Comfort and cleanliness are top priorities when choosing a hotel and the Nikko excelled at both. As we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary the hotel gave us a bottle of champagne which was a lovely surprise. Breakfast was very good in the Anzu restaurant. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for all the reasons stated above and the location is perfect for exploring the great city of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: k p
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but there were a couple things that made it not outstanding. When I checked I gave them my name and was asked I'd be ok with a room with 2 beds, I replied no Id like a king room. Yes it was my fault that I didn't get my paperwork out then, but once I had unpacked and settled in my queen bed handicap accessible room, I realized I was booked in a king room. I tried calling the front desk to get the rate adjusted as I didn't feel like packing back up and moving after a long day of site seeing, but they said the queen and king rooms were the same rate. noted. I just really feel that if you were booked into something they shouldn't have tried to put me in a different room. The other issue was that I had used the coffee machine to make hot tea. I use loose tea and cloth bags for tea. One morning I left the loose tea in a bag (they are larger than a normal teabag and are made of fabric) and the maid threw it out. I complained and was offered a free breakfast coupon. Great but that doesnt replace the cloth bag. Heck I'm several blocks from Chinatown and Id thought they'd know what loose tea looked like but I guess not. I did have an issue with the internet too. I called the front desk about the connection and they transferred me to another person. What they didn't tell me was that they were transferring me to an outside line and charging me for the phone call. FAIL. Overall not a horrible stay but not the best. Bed was comfy and clean. Oh and why have an HD tv if you aren't going to have HD cable??

Reviews.Title: “Good value,nice room,Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tigerjo3
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay, after some mix up with the reservation, was upgraded to Club level room, this was nice, enjoyed the daily breakfast and snacks in the Club each day. Room was well maintained, clean, my only negative is the lighting in the rooms, not too good and the lamps and lamp shades are seriously out of date, ugly, don't match the rest of the decor. Overall a nice hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Expensive Wifi”
Reviews.Author: Mia1985
Reviews.Content: Wifi is 17 dollars a day PER device ... not to mention they use ATT wifi service instead of their own wifi. If the wifi is going to be that expensive it should be at least 2 devices (phone and laptop). Other than that great large rooms and perfect location.
