Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: binowest
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel when I did this year's Nike Womens Marathon. It was only a block and a half from the starting line, on the trolley line and near everything in Union Square. We had a Starbucks on site. They also have a very good restaurant/bar at the hotel. All kinds of restaurants and shopping are right in the area. The rooms are very nice, service was very good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to explore San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: lv2plan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Nikko because my husband had a meeting there. It turned out to be the perfect spot for his meeting, and for me to get out and explore the city. The location made it an easy walk to the MUNI/BART startion, the cable cars, and there is an Enterprise car rental on the lower level of the hotel, so at the end of the meeting we were able to easily pick up a car for a few days and explore Carmel and Big Sur. Upon returning the car it was easy to walk to the BART startion to get back to the airport. We asked for an upgrade at check in and ended up on the Imperial level on the 23rd floor. This was a great location because there is a concerige lounge just down the hall that has happy hour every afternoon, and breakfast in the mornings. It also gave us access to the pool and exercise room, and wireless was included. I also believe the rooms are a bit larger at this level. Room was clean and bed was very comfortable. Loved the soft robes! My only complaint was that there were a few stains on the carpet and the window exterior needed cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: ytakarada
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival, I was notified that the room I had was not available and they had to give me a smaller room to accomadate me. It was no matter to me as I was only staying a night and I had gotten the room through my credit card rewards program so it was no charge to me. They gave me free access to the gym and also to the imperial lounge on the high floors which included a nice continental breakfast for the disservice. To be honest, I didn't even know what type of room I had booked so I was all pleasantly surprised. The room was small but sufficed for myself. The gym and pool was huge, magnificent for a hotel in the area. If you had to pay, it's worth the $10. They even kept my bags and let me come back to the hotel, use the gym, pool and shower before my red eye flight which was great. Location cannot be beat, in the middle of everything! And the hotel was spotless. The only downside to my stay was that I could only stayed for a night and that some parts of the hotel made me very nostalgic for Japan. But best part of the hotel as other's reported is that the service is wonderful. Reception, conceirge and bell men. I was very impressed especially after having just stayed at the Westin St Francis around the corner which was just efficient. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatieR1988
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel in the Union Square district of San Francisco. After travelling for nearly 27 hours we arrived at the hotel to be greeted by friendly staff who made our check in as quick as possible. The room was clean and I can honestly say we did not have one complaint during our whole stay! The location is great as it is only 2 blocks from union square and the cable car turn around (beware this does get very busy from mid morning on!) I have read on other reviews about the number of homeless people on neighbouring blocks however I found there to be homeless people throughout the city and not just in this neighbourhood. Hotel Nikko added to the wonderful experience we had in San Francisco, and I hope to be able to return at some point!

Reviews.Title: “Champagne taste on bologna budget”
Reviews.Author: kitkat951
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel for a fabulous price! We were so pleased with our stay and will definitely stay again! It is in close proximity to Union Square, BART, and everything else that a first time tourist to SFO would likely look for. We have been to SFO several times before and our reason for this trip was for a conference. But we still had time to enjoy the city and walk around and see the sights, and our location at Hotel Nikko was so convenient. We will definitely come back - the value could not be beat and the accommodations were superb.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: dnpinva
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. I got a great deal, booking through United and using a combination of miles and some money down. The hotel is immaculate. It looks and feels crisp and clean, partly due to the Asian aesthetic and partly due to incredible upkeep. The room was large for San Francisco, and the beds were very comfortable. Views through the large picture windows on the upper floors are stunning. The bathroom was a delight with a large vanity, pleasant lighting, and a fantastic shower with superb water pressure. The gym is great, but prepare to pay an extra $10 to use it (very reasonable). The location is ideal, just a couple blocks from Union Square and near great restaurants and bars. The neighborhood feels quite safe, but within about five blocks south and west, it can deteriorate rapidly, but this is San Francisco, so it's a good idea to watch your belongings wherever you go. Service was first-rate - friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “25th Wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: john r
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel which was spacious,neat,clean,comfortable,quiet and had a great view of the bay. It was perfectly located for tourists and was central for everything we needed. A 20 minute journey on the BART from the airport and a 5 minute walk from the train stop it couldn't have been more convenient to get to. All the staff were very pleasant and attentive, we had no complaints with this hotel and would gladly stay there again if we are lucky enough to be back in this wonderful part of the world again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmmaS26
Reviews.Content: The nikko is well situated near to union square, rooms were ok but they were small, and nothing special. The worst thing was the fact you had to pay extra for everything- water in the room, use of the pool, wifi, and any decent tv channels! Parking was also extortionate at Â£30 for 24hours, though probably on a par with other SF hotels! Given the number of hotels in SF, I think we could have found better for the price!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cbehan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights of our honeymoon and really enjoyed our stay it was centrally located to explore the city and a great Irish Bar close by with live music at weekends. The hotel was clean, rooms modern and spotless but our room was very small and with a couple of large suitcases each it did pose a bit of a problem but this is the only negative thing we have to say about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nikko Hotel, SF, CA”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl S
Reviews.Content: Location Location, with in walking distance of Union Square, Shopping and fine dining. Hotel staff was professional and attentive. This hotel has an elegant appearance and very clean. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: tramwj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Nikko. Our room was spacious and clean. My wife and I found the room decor to be modern and elegant. Flat screen TV, earth tone colors, and a large window with a view of the streets below. At the time, I was afraid that the noise level would be a problem (based on other reviews), but we had no problems sleeping, but that could also be related to how high we were (11th floor). The staff was excellent. Each time we left the hotel or entered, friendly staff opened the doors for us and said, "Hello." There was no mistreatment at all. For my wife and I, the location was great (see farther down for more elaboration on location). If you have no problems walking, it's easy to walk to where you need to go. Union square is very close, as are the cable cars, and the mall. A little bit more about the room. I'm only including this so that I can create a more thorough review, because I know that this matters to some people: The carpet and some of the furniture was a little bit worn. It didn't bother my wife and I at all. Location:The location is the only reason I did not give this hotel 5 stars, but allow me to explain; if you are familiar with the streets in this area (as my wife and I were), and traveling the wrong way on foot is not a concern, then I give this place 5 stars. However, if you are not familiar with the streets, you could possibly go out walking into a bad area. You don't walk outside directly into a bad area, but if you walk a few blocks in the wrong direction, you can end up somewhere you really shouldn't be, and for this reason only, I give 4 instead of 5 stars. The solution is easy though: Simply make sure you understand where you're walking before you head out, and you'll be fine. I highly recommend Hotel Nikko, and will gladly stay at this Hotel again in the future. The rooms had one of the nicest interiors I've seen in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Janet A
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Nikko was fabulous. I felt pampered knowing that before and during my stay I had staff who were ready and willing to cheerfully and promptly help me with anything I needed! The facilities, both our guestroom and conference room, were immaculate, tasteful and modern. Computer/internet facilities were readily available both wi-fi for my own computer in the hotel room or using the wireless keyboard with the tv in the room. Also, the business center was useful. The downtown location of the hotel was perfect being just a few short blocks from Union Station, Market Street, the cable car line, and the BART. And the concierge was very accomodating in assisting with tour arrangements, especially Tower Tours which have hotel pickup and dropoff for their tours! I would definitely stay at the Hotel Nikko again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: beamaling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in early September. The location is excellent close to Union Square and loads of shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is lovely, very modern and clean, with the bathroom being very large. We found the staff to be efficient especially the concierge who arranged a trip for us. We would definitely stay there again. The only down sides were the price of wi-fi, in a hotel of this standard or pretty much any hotel these days I would expect wi-fi to come as standard and the choice of food in house (Japanese).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nikko for 2 nights in late August while on a family vacation in SF. The room was good and spacious, the location was excellent --lots of great restaurants nearby and close to the shops. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was big and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice lodging with access to everything”
Reviews.Author: OhioBean1314
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Nikko for a conference. The accommodations are great -plush, comfortable. I was lucky to be on one of the top three special floors with access to gym and free wireless, but even my colleagues' rooms on other floors were great. The hotel is centrally located to everything (2 blocks from BART/train, near Chinatown, short walk to Union Square, trolley lines, shopping, drug stores, even on Sunday this downtown neighborhood had a lot of activity going on and shops and restaurants open late). It was really great stay and great location. Service for rooms is great - desk service was a little slow at all times no matter how many people are standing in line. But they make up for it in the extent/quality of service they give you once you get their attention. There is also a great nightclub called the Razz Room in the lobby - they have these great unexpected jazz performers and singers almost every night. Meeting rooms were nice - the set-up of space was great (vicinity of ballroom to meeting rooms, locations of bathrooms, windows in most meeting rooms). The only downside I saw (from a business meeting perspective) is the limited food options in the hotel - Starbucks in the lobby closed for renovations when we were there, and there is no deli/coffee bar sort of set up in the hotel (except for full service restaurant); and the catering and restaurant are insanely expensive (a bottle of water catering price was $5.00 each, and Sunday brunch buffet- the only food option available in the hotel on Sundays is $48.00 per person). Access to outside restaurants outside the hotel is great (but if you have a packed meeting schedule and no time to get out of the hotel - you are stuck with the coffee pot provided in your room, and higher end full service restaurant).Other services are equally high priced ($19.95 for one day internet access in your hotel room, $1.00 per printed page in the business center). There is also this quirky "automated mini bar" in guest rooms that charges you automatically if you touch or move any item in your refrigerator (so no moving stuff out to keep your beverages or leftovers cold). However, the hotel was kind enough to bring a separate mini-fridge to my room for my personal items :) Overall, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel downtown, beware of Tenderloin”
Reviews.Author: Tampapair
Reviews.Content: The Nikko hotel was a nice hotel but not what we would call fabulous. Clean, competent, courteous within walking distance of Union Square. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We dialed 360 on our room phone whenever we needed our car and the valet always had it ready. We were bidding on Priceline hoping for the Westin St. Francis but got the Nikko instead. We won the bid at $229 but paid an extra $20 when we checked in, hoping to get a nicer room. We'd stay there again for less than $240 but would not more. San Francisco is a great pedestrian city and you don't need your car to enjoy it. You won't enjoy paying $51 per day to park there either. The front desk will give you a map which, oddly enough, does not have the neighborhood Tenderloin detailed on it. You really, really want to avoid the Tenderloin. When you walk out of the hotel, go East then North or South but do NOT go West. We'd been to San Fran many times and always heard the Tenderloin is a place to avoid. We inadvertently walked block after block after block through it in the middle of the day, and we feel fortunate that it was uneventful. Normally I would not dwell on a neighborhood but another review suggested it is somehow adventurous or romantic to stroll through this neighborhood. It is neither, don't waste your time or put yourself at risk. Also, given the probable large portion of out of town visitors this hotel must accommodate, it's inappropriate that the hotel does not offer any words of caution to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “The Ulitimate Bait and Switch!”
Reviews.Author: justiceinaustin
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I found this online. We are actually here now!! We wanted a nicer hotel, something different than the Hilton or Marriott. Upon arrival, long valet line, rude valet people, rude check in clerk. They basically said our room was tiny and convinced us to upgrade for more money, gym more money, valet more money, business center more money, pool more money! All of this with horrible rude service!! Also it is on the edge of a shady part of town! We will never come back!

Reviews.Title: “Pick Nikko”
Reviews.Author: RussHonolulu
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Convenient location to meeting sites, shopping, transportation, and restaurants. Hotel property and rooms very clean. Top notch service from friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “I Highly Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lbtwist
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews, and was happy that I did. (I am still puzzled as to why it is not included in the guidebooks.) As others have said, the Union Square location is convenient, and provided a perfect base for exploring all of San Francisco. The lobby is pretty, and everyone who worked there was warm and courteous. The room, while not lavish, was well-appointed and immaculate, and the bathroom was nice. I appreciated the fact that everything in the room looked new, and the common areas were very nicely-maintained. My only gripe is the extra charge for internet serviceâ€”and I had to pay it twice because we had two laptops. On the positive side, I accidentally left money in the safe, and the hotel kindly arranged to send it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Nikko”
Reviews.Author: Shanghai_sam
Reviews.Content: Our original plan was to stay in the Clift or Monaco hotel however prior to booking Expedia had a hotel sale and we got an excellent rate at the Nikko for three nights on the imperial floor. On arrival we were offered an upgrade of a junior suite for $60 per night which we took. The room was spacious, spotless and quiet. All the staff were friendly and extremely helpful when we had any quieries. The hotel has a real tranquil calm feel to it, buffet breakfast was superb with great choice and quality especially the fresh fruit selection. On the back of the great breakfast we ate in ANZU for one evening meal which again was faultless, service was attentive without being obtrusive, we were also given 15% of our food bill as we were staying at the hotel. Can't recommend this hotel enough, great location near union square, next to all the car rental places and a good Irish bar right next door for good food and drink. Will stay again if in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great service. Definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: cubacubaSydney
Reviews.Content: Booked high-level Executive King-bed room, and not disappointed. Twice as good as our previous hotel, the Crowne Plaza Times square, and far less cost. very friendly and helpful check-n. Changed rooms to get the best view for us. Room was not large, but great ambience and decor. Wonderful bathroom. Excellent Flat sceen, mini-bar and all amenities. On same floor as Executive Lounge which was convenient. really wonderful breakfast included. helpful breakfast staff. easy parking. Stored luggage whilst we went away for two weeks. Would higly recommend. Also a very convenient area, teo blocks to times Square, Macey's etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: BIG_BOZ_Leeds
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the nikko for 5 nights in Sept 2011 as the first leg of my honeymoon. Fabulous location for shopping at union square, 150m from the cable car turn around point where u get on it, restaurants in abundance, approx 1hr walk to fishermans warf. Hotel didnt have free WiFi, although the star bucks in the lobby does, and its quick even from outside, so no stress on that front. Didn't eat in the hotel, purely as there is so much locally. I would recommend the dim sum at the Chinese just over the road from the sbucks down the hill to gte right also the Indian buffet which looks horrific from outside about 100m up the road left from the hotel door was very good.....I live in bradford so believe me when I say its good! Also Lois diner is brilliant round the corner next to wallgreens. The room was a good size with modern fit and finish, also the gym is excellent and well worth the 10 bucks per room per start usage, for the sauna and steam room alone. Special thanks to Rick on the concierge desk, very useful guy who never got stumped by a question and was always keen to help. Highly recommended if you are heading to san fran, I went to the raddison @ fwarf to meet a mate and frankly it was crap compared to the nikko and cost nearly 3 times as much. Also the warf is very tacky and full of tourists.....which generally I can not abide! As an aside, I would recommend the alcatraz tour it was great (book online in advance though nearly half price!) Also get the cable car back from the warf not to it, the views are better in that direction and the Q was much shorter! Finally on the subject of parking, yes its a lot but not much more than the other secure options, and u can call from your room for your motor, so for me the extra few quid was worth the convenience, choice is yours! In summary, not a bad word to say about the hotel, and would recommend highly for a city hotel in san fran at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Battle By The Bay”
Reviews.Author: Newport2me
Reviews.Content: Well, we (FSU) fans had a tuff time watching our team lose to Cal! But all was not lost! Our stay at the Nikko made up for our loss. Great comfortable beds, fabulous location to all in San Francisco. 1blk off of Powell and less than two blks away from Union Square, Macy's, Sears Restaurant, Neiman Marcus, Saks 5th Avenue, etc. Hotel staff was wonderful! Knowledgeable, friendly, curteous and even knew some football speak about Fresno State! Thank you hotel Nikko and Staff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “luxury accommodation = luxury price”
Reviews.Author: kindred27
Reviews.Content: Our flight got cancelled at midnight on labor day weekend and Hotel Nikko was the only one that had rooms at 2am Sunday. The lady at the front desk was very efficient at checking us in. We got one of those rooms on the imperial club floor (22nd floor) - you need to insert your card key on the elevator to get to your floor. The room was huge with great views of the city and our only complaint was that there were too many doors at the washroom, at least 3 I think. The tv on the bathroom mirror was really cool. Be careful about moving stuff on the fridge, or you'll be automatically charged, call front desk if you need extra fridge space. The free breakfast was great with lots of choices - it's a $22 value and they will charge you $5 tip on your room bill. We paid a total of $300 for one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “11th Anniversary in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: rjones77
Reviews.Content: Just a last minute weekend trip to San Francisco, My wife and I spurged for our 11th anniversary, caught a flight to San Francisco, and stayed at the elegant and charmming Hotel Nikko San Francisco. With less than 60 hours to enjoy, we took in every moment possible. The Hotel Nikko was definately the way to go with an upgraded junior suite overlooking the town of San Fran. Close to many attractions and restaurants, we spent a good deal of time walking to the various places and shopping. Close to China Town, we hung around in the vacinity quite a bit. Taxis to the pier and shuttle to and from the airport. Didn't dine in the restaurants, although we told the checkin girl it was our anniversary and we were surprise with a bottle of champagne. Good room service, expensive, yet tasty. Save some cash, eat out!

Reviews.Title: “Lets you concentrate on your holiday”
Reviews.Author: Judge404
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights here and our stay was totally uneventful from an accomodation perspective. Perfect! It's not often that an hotel gets it all right, but the Nikko just blended into the background perfectly, letting us get on with our holiday activities without a worry in the world. The hotel is stylishly decorated and well serviced. The rooms are elegant and well equipped, and the service is invisible yet highly effective. Position is awesome - at the heart of it all in SF. Would definitely come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: tyhe
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious rooms in central San Francisco. Perhaps not located in the most cosy part of town but close to a BART station. Staff was friendly but no free wifi. A plus was the Starbucks located in the same building.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: Larryo
Reviews.Content: outstanding location and very comfy hotel. The only complaint was the business center, which nickle-dimed. facilities are very nice. stayed there for 5 nights and would have loved it if it were longer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Hotel Nikko. Absolutely no negatives here.”
Reviews.Author: MrJeph
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a 4-day trip to San Fran in Sep 2011. Got a great rate on Expedia for this property and felt pretty confident in it upon reading reviews here. We arrived in SF by plane, took the BART to Union Square. Literally a 2 block walk to the hotel from all major transit lines (BART & MUNI). Hotel is large and modern with rooms larger than most in the area (the bathroom alone seemed larger than some hotel rooms elsewhere!). The building and rooms were clean, quiet, and comfortable with all amenities needed. Customer service was great through check-in, check-out, and luggage storage. Received a mini-fridge in the room at no charge. I can't comment on the restaurant or pool as we never used either. Would have liked to see the pool at the very least, but never made time for it. Hotels and shops all within walking distance, including the Westfield Mall. Starbucks also onsite. Paid no hidden costs or extra fees. Absolutely no complaints - will recommend and stay again if in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Susannah1952
Reviews.Content: We arrived on an early morning flight and the room we had reserved was not ready, so they upgraded up to a bigger room on a higher floor at same rate. Loved everything about the hotel - modern and immaculate. There is a connecting door from the lower lobby to a busy Starbucks - we bought our lattes & pastry, then went to a comfortable quiet sitting area an escalator up from the main lobby to a mezzanine - it was perfect! The staff was helpful and quietly respectful. It's a little more expensive than nearby hotels but you can catch a good "sale" on Expedia as we did.

Reviews.Title: “VIP Experience”
Reviews.Author: KatnKris
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out our car we were given the VIP treatment. All staff went out of their way to make sure everything about our stay at the NIKKO SF was top notch. Rooms were very clean and the beds were quite comfortable. The welcome cheese and cracker plate was a great touch. We also really enjoyed the Sunday brunch in the ANZO restaurant. We will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a trip to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoVisitor
Reviews.Content: The Nikko is located a short walk from the Bart, Cable cars, and Union Square so you get a great start each morning. When you arrive at the Nikko expect the best and you won't be disappointed, everyone will help you with a smile. Your room will be clean, well appointed, and comfortable for a good nights sleep. From the large bathroom to the unusually good in room coffee the Nikko raises the bar for hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: I would definately recommend staying at Nikko! Me and my girlfriend stayed for a week in august, and we would without any doubt do it again! We stayed in a deluxe room (due to a great bargain on hotelsclick.com!), which was great. A lovely bathroom, FANTASTIC beds, great TV and furniture. The downsides (which were minor) was the difficult to use coffee maker, a view towards dirty old buildings and the not included WIFI. It is really hard to believe that such a modern and well equipped hotel do not offer free WIFI! If you do need to use the internet (and do not want to pay 16 dollars for 24 hours) you can use it at Starbucks, which is right next to the hotel exit! So don't spend your money on the pricey internet, have coffee and WIFI at Starbucks! Besides that we were very satisfied with our stay. If you need a fridge for cold drinks or food, you can just ask for it in the reception and they will install it in your room! Some reviewers say that the surrounding streets can be dangerous at night time. That is in some way true. There are (as in all over San Francisco) homeless people and tough guys hanging out on the street corners, but that is no different to big cities like New York, London or whereever. I would recommend not walking about in the middle of the night, and during the day time you should be aware of holding on to your belongings. But I guess you have to do that everywhere nowadays. Stay at Nikko and you will not be dissapointed! And remember to use hotelsclick. 9 out of 10 times it is cheaper than hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “If I ever go back to SF, I will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: bremt06
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative reviews about this hotel, I was a little worried about what our travel agent had gotten us into for our honeymoon trip no less. But we found the hotel very beautiful with great amenities. We used the Starbucks outside the hotel for wireless instead of paying the $15/day internet fee and we didn't mind paying the one time $10 charge for the workout facility/pool because we stayed 3 nights and used it each night. We had no problems with mystery mini bar fees. We made sure to request a mini fridge to be brought up to our room for free for some leftovers we brought back. Breakfast buffet in the Anzu is great and worth the $22. Location probably couldn't get any better right next to Union Square, Powell Station, and the Cable Car turnaround.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: vivianex
Reviews.Content: Great location, well furnished, comfortable, nice, everything we were expecting!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: poppyclock
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious & a great shower - these alone earn Hotel Nikko high praise! Combined with a convenient location (so close to Union Square and an easy drive to USF where our son is a student) and excellent service, I can't think of anything I would change about our 4-day stay. Another plus: the Nikko has one of the nicest, well-furnished gyms I've ever been to at a hotel in its price range. Important reminders: San Francisco is a noisy city at all hours of the day and night. If you are sensitive, bring ear-plugs. We did and slept well. Also, as others have noted, the weather can get cold very quickly. Pack & dress in layers; you will need to remove & add throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelling_JM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Deluxe King room, booked via Hotels.com. The room was spacious, clean and well maintained. Hotel Nikko's location was great - less than 5 minutes walk to Market & Powell, where we could hop onto the cable car or F-line streetcar which took us to pretty much everywhere a tourist would go.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay at the Nikko”
Reviews.Author: Dealette
Reviews.Content: It's a great location for us, close to buses & BART - no driving. The hotel is efficient with an excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Sharon S
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Nikko in August; the location is super - close to Union Square, Market Street and the Nordstrom/Bloomingdale shopping center. Staff is helpful and accomodating. Our room, a junior suite, is nicely furnished, nicely sized; maid service is unobtrusive and thorough. Their Anzu restaurant is good for breakfast/lunch. (One drawback - tables are close together - privacy is non-existent). Elevators are ultra speedy. We are already planning our return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Solchildx23
Reviews.Content: Love, love, loved this hotel! Stayed here for a travel package for Outside Lands Music Festival. Clean, modern style. The beds were so comfy! The bathroom was roomy and the shower was great! Service and staff were excellent! Can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: zendude
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Hotel Nikko during a business trip. The front desk services is very helpful for a late arrival (10 pm) and helped reserved a table for me in their hotel restaurant so I can get a quick bite after a long day of travel. The room was clean but a little bit small (it is understandable given it is in at the heart of a big city).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: lhdeason
Reviews.Content: Found two rooms on Expedia for a wonderful rate. The hotel was beautiful. The rooms were spacious and modern, a great location near Union Square. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dreamer3007
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 10 night stay in San Francisco for our honeymoon. Hotel Nikko was the first hotel we stayed in and we spent 5 nights there. It is very central and easy to find after arriving on the BART from the airport. The lobby is very clean and check in was easy. We had a room on the 18th floor, the decor was all very new and the room was very clean. The bed was amazingly comfortable and the bathroom was huge, with everything you would need. Even though the hotel was central, it was very quiet. The only downside was the mini bar which was automatically activated if you removed anything which meant you would be charged so you couldn't keep anything in the fridge. We paid $10 to have use of the fitness suite, the pool was incredibly shallow and full of children when we went but the steam room and sauna in the changing rooms were great and just what we needed after a day walking around the city. Overall it was a very comfortable hotel and we would definitely recommend .

Reviews.Title: “It is my second stay and I loved it more than the first time”
Reviews.Author: mariale20031
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Imperial Rooms, everything is perfect, the room, the view, the cleanness and of course the attention of every single one in Nikko. Thanks for all and I will be back again as soon as I can, I loved San Francisco.Excellent room service and the restaurant Anzzu is fabulous. I am from Argentina and I went with my daughter, we had a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SierraatTahoe11
Reviews.Content: Awesome city views, clean, well appointed rooms with large bath, walking distance to Union Square, amazing sushi at Anzu, super friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, I loved it”
Reviews.Author: vegas51
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, really central for the city and easy to get to all the attractions from here. The room was really good and the ambience is just right. Starbucks is next door too. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Offers anything you would expect from a ggod hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gresk
Reviews.Content: Ecellent service for a trouble fre accomodation Very spacious room with comfortable double king size beds Located in the hart of the city Very clean and quiet pace

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a good location. Don't expect service with a smile though!”
Reviews.Author: nin77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April of this year. We were in San Francisco twice in the same trip so stayed at the Nikko both times, with a combined total of seven nights. Unfortunately that meant having to deal with the front desk staff twice! The front desk staff seemed to have a distinct lack of interest in their guests which bordered on rudeness (apart from one older gentleman who was very pleasant). However, I have to say that the concierge was BRILLIANT and really made up for the bad attitude present at the front desk. He was friendly and really very helpful. The front desk staff should look and learn ï�Š The hotel has a great location. Hotel Nikko is really central, within walking distance to Union Square, Market St etc. and really close to the BART. There is a great range of bars and restaurants around the hotel and there is a Starbucks and Enterprise car rental on the ground floor. As with most places in SF city centre, be prepared to be frequently approached by homeless people looking for money, cigarettes etc. The rooms are nice enough â€“ nothing fantastic. Beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. We stayed in two different rooms and the first one seemed to be a more spacious room for the same price. The bathrooms are very nice. There is plenty of room in the bathroom with a good shower and spotlessly clean. We didnâ€™t eat at Anzu but popped in to the bar for a drink a few of the evenings. The bar is nice, with comfy seats. The service was not very good in the bar â€“ it was practically empty there one night but there was still a wait at the bar. There were shows on in the hotel while we were there in the Rrazz Room, so the crowd in the bar in the evenings seemed to be either coming from or going to a show. If you want a bit more atmosphere while having a drink, just pop around the corner to Foleys Pub â€“ recommended! As we arrived very late on our first night, we ate from the room service menu which was tasty and delivered very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: AlbuquerqueTony
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for three nights and would definitely stay there again. I had a deluxe queen room which I still thought was small, but that's the standard for San Fran. What was great was that the door opened to a long hallway. The room itself was down the hallway and around the corner which almost eliminated hall noise! THAT was awesome. Professional staff. Central location. Great views. A little noisy, due to lots of people in the area; if you don't like crowds, don't stay in ANY Union Square hotel (in fairness, the Hotel Nikko is not as near to the crowds in Union Square as a few others are). Only minor complaint: the "hotel services" menu on the TV had issues; among them, I couldn't checkout on there.

Reviews.Title: “A+ You can not go wrong with Hotel Nikko!”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for three nights while traveling to San Francisco for some sightseeing as well as to run the half marathon. You will notice we rated this location 5 starsâ€¦.which we do not give lightlyâ€¦but they earned the positive review for sure with such a polished product. As we spent a few days in Napa/Sonoma prior to arriving at the Nikko so we arrived by rental car. Itâ€™s a bit confusing to find the driveway entry but not bad. The hotel bellman took our bags, allowed us to park for 15 minutes to check in, and then we returned our car and walked back to the hotel. Super easy. Check in was quick and efficient. Valet and Bell services are on the lowest level, lobby is on the second level. Our room was ready when we checked in just before 4pm. Our return back to Oakland airport was a short 5 minute walk to the BART station, then a train to the Oakland station, followed by a short bus ride to the terminal. Very easy and not susceptible to traffic conditions like a cab. (Plus MUCH cheaper!) The location was about 2 easy blocks off the center of Union Square. We felt safe walking in the area, but of course keep your eyes open and be aware of your surroundings. Yes, the Tenderloin district is nearby (opposite direction from Union Square), but if you are aware of that, you can avoid the area. Yes, there are homeless people around occasionally asking for money, but that is the case with all the metro areaâ€¦not just where this hotel is located. Fishermanâ€™s Wharf area is a short taxi ride (about $8 + tip) or you can take the cable car. The cable car is $6 per person, but takes about an hour + the time for the line. If you have never ridden the cable carâ€¦.of by all means, take the time to ride it! If the cable car is a â€œbeen there done thatâ€� for you, (like it was for us) than I would say save your money, take a taxi, and get there quicker! There were either 2 or 4 of us depending on the trip, so it was always less expensive to take a cab. Hailing a cab down on Fishermanâ€™s Wharf can be challenging but we had success within 5 minutes walking â€œinlandâ€� a block or two and being observant and quick on our feet. (Donâ€™t look for a cab near a cable car or street car stop!) The hotel has wonderful gym with quite a tons of cardio equipment, (including TV's), a weight system, yoga mats, and other equipment all overlooking the city. There is a very nice indoor pool and hot tub. We used the hot tub each night. Both the pool and workout room were a comfortable temperature (which sometimes is not the case with an indoor pool) The locker rooms also have showers and steam room. One thing to note, there is a $10 per day charge, per room for access to the health club an pool. It was included in my corporate rate so it was not an issue, but something I wanted to point out. That being said, around 8:30 or 9pm when we went, there was nobody there to collect the fee. The lobby is welcoming and quiet with soft music playing. They have a nicely appointed business center but we never used it. Newspapers of several types were available for free in the lobby each morning. There is also a small convenience pantry next to the front desk. We never went in so cannot comment, but it is nice to have if you want something quick. The concierge of course printed our boarding passes for us, so we never had the occasion to use the business center. The hotel has internet access for a fee, though I am not exactly sure how much it costs, as it was also included in my corporate rate. The internet access was acceptable from a speed standpoint. We were on a discounted corporate rate, but still received a very nice room on the 19th floor. The view was nothing spectacular, but nice none the less. The room was quiet and we did not experience any excessive city noises. About all we ever heard was the occasional emergency vehicle. The rooms were nicely decorated, with full windows and very comfortable with nice modern decoration. The windows could use washing outside though. The king sized bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. We called down to get some foam pillows and extra towels and were quickly accommodated. The curtains did an excellent job of blocking out the light. They have nice flat screen TV's with sufficient channels, and the room included a large work desk, plenty of plugs, a dresser, nice closet, and a lounge chair / ottoman. Our room had a separate room for the toilet, a vanity outside the bathroom, and a bar / minibar (for a fee). The sink, shower, and separate bath tub were in the main bathroom. The bathrooms were well stocked with nice toiletries and were replenished daily. Our friends said that their room had a standard bathroom layout. There is a coffee/tea maker, ice bucket, and mini bar. (No room in minibar for personal items) Everything was spotlessly clean. The climate control works well with the only negative being we never seemed to be able to leave the blower motor on for white noise. The towels were nice and fluffy and the sheets were comfortable. Across the board, the staff at this hotel was excellent and always friendly, including the valet, bell staff, front desk, concierge, restaurant, and housekeeping. Housekeeping always took care of any special requests and did an excellent job servicing the room. One really cool thing, the morning I was running the half marathon, my wife awoke a bit before her wakeup call and was in the shower at the time of the call. The hotel went above and beyond in my opinion, which was so neat. About 15 minutes after the designated wakeup callâ€¦a staff member knocked on the door to make sure that she did not oversleep. How cool! There are tons of dining options near hotel. On our first night we dined in the hotelâ€™s Asian restaurant. We all agreed the food, service, and bar service was very good, all in a relaxing environment. Though the restaurant was not inexpensive by any means, the food quality associated with the price is appropriate, and on par with restaurants outside the hotel. Room service is available 24/7 and seemed relatively reasonable. (Given it was room service that is.) There is no shortage of dining options in easy 5 minute walking distance and the concierge was always happy to make recommendations. There is also a Starbucks at the end of the hotel lobby. The only oddity I can really think of is that when we checked out, we had some $100 Visa Debit cards we wanted to apply to their room (employer incentives) and for some reason their system must preauthorize tips or something, so all the front desk could apply is 85% of the cards value. We have used these at other hotels without a problem. Worth noting for sure, but not a big dealâ€¦..and given this was the only thing that was not absolutely perfect, I have no complaints. We would highly recommend this hotel. We are very happy having stayed here. Convenient to all the tourist attractions as well as our race expo and start. Thanks for a great Stay Hotel Nikko!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nikko San Francisco Nike Womens Marathon”
Reviews.Author: Thoop8
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Nikko 10/15-10/18 for the Nike Women's San Francisco Marathon. Booked a double standard room and requested a fridge be placed in room as well. Arrived on Friday @ 12 and was immediately able to use room. Very nice room and fairly large for SF standards. Fridge was in room as requested which was fabulous since we were there to run a marathon and needed liquids! The only complaint that I have of room is would have been nice to have a large mirror in the actual room area to utilize as vanity. Hotel is located directly across the street from Hilton which was being picketed, loud blaring megaphones starting at the crack of dawn which is no fault of Nikko. Unpacked and headed to Nike tent for registration. Perfect location to Marathon starting line, not soooo close to be crazy loud but close enough to not exhaust our legs before a marathon. Loved the beds, super comfortable. Starbucks is located in lower level but the line was always so long didn't have patience to deal with it. Nikko also has a restaurant and a lounge/bar, didn't patron them but they looked nice. Nikko boasts an indoor pool/hottub/spa. After 26.2 miles of running we wanted nothing more then to soak in the hottub. Walked through the spa which was beautiful and hit the hottub which was lukewarm at best. We did call maintenance and within 10 minutes the water temperature was fixed and we were soaking our exhausted muscles. The hottub is a little dated but still did the trick. Staff was courteous and efficient. We are again heading for SF to run the Marathon 20/2011 and have booked the Nikko again. I highly recommend it to anyone who is heading for San Fran for that great race!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location/Close to Shops/Restaurants; Lots of Tourists”
Reviews.Author: tiggles002
Reviews.Content: I was able to secure 4 nights in July 2011 @ Hotel Nikko at a great value for an average price of $140. I just saw the the average price for a Friday through Monday in August 2011(same timing during the week as my trip) is now $317! I obviously will see much more value in the cost of my four nights compares to someone who will pay more than double my cost. Anyway, the hotel is in a great location (in Union Square) and near many shops/restaurants and in walking distance to many different places if you don't mind sweating a little bit. We actually walked to Lombard Street (Crookedest Street in the World) room the hotel and then down to Fisherman's wharf since the cable car line was insanely crowded with tourists and on the expensive end. This enabled us to walk through China town and North Beach and take in the city. It was quite enjoyable. The hotel is also a couple of blocks away from Blazing Saddles, a bicycle shop, which is very convenient. We rented bikes @ 9 am and biked through the Golden Gate Park, the Presidio, and then over the Golden Gate Bridge into Sausilito. We then took a ferry back to Fisherman's Wharf and then biked the rest of the way back to the hotel. As far as the hotel is concerned, the room was on the smaller end as expected, but clean and comfortable. We were able to get a mini fridge at no additional cost. The hotel had a pool and fitness area available for $10, which included a nice steam room. As fat as negatives are concerned, showering left a bit desired as the water pressure wasn't great and the televisions are not HD - these things could definitely be updated. Also, we arrived Friday night, gave our baggage to the guy in the check-in parking area and then proceeded upstairs to the check-in desk with our baggage claim ticket. We gave the baggage ticket to the lady once we checked in and also asked for her to charge us for the fitness center and pool area. We realized after an hour (after not receiving our luggage) that the lady never told anyone to get our luggage. This was quite an annoyance as it took a little bit for them to track down he location of our luggage. Additionally, that same night, when we went to use our card to go to the pool area, we were declined access. The same lady didn't add this access to our card as we instructed. The hotel could have comped us for the inconvenience at the very least. The conceriege desk is excellent and they are very helpful and accommodating. WiFi is available at a cost of about $10/night. Parking is extremely expensive if you have a rental car; we found a local lot for about half the price. All in all, we were happy with our experience given the amount of money we paid for a four night stay in an expensive city like San Francisco, but would never pay $317 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Better than we could have imagined!”
Reviews.Author: KCP_Easton
Reviews.Content: Our Jetsetter rate was a bit pricey, but because it was all-inclusive, we signed on & paid up. We have not been disappointed. The rate included a two hour afternoon reception, full buffet breakfast, use of the exercise room, Internet, and all with a wonderfully-appointed room on the 22nd floor. Great location, everything about the place works for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, small room”
Reviews.Author: holicow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days for a business conference. This was my first visit to SF, so I'm not up on how much things normally cost. Our group rate was 199 per night for a "Petite Queen" room. I found the room to be pretty small, I bumped into the furniture a lot and I was traveling by myself. The room might be too small for two people to move around comfortably. However, the food at the Rrazz room and service in general were impeccable. The hotel is within walking distance of good restaurants and the Moscone Center.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TravlAdvisor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the heart near Union Square. Room size is good and pretty comforatble. Located at just a minute walk from the Main Street for shopping eating. The hotels in this area are anyways very expensive, considering that this is a really good bet. Lot of places to shop and eat (including a couple of Indian Restaurants serving really good food). My take - go for it.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: dude49
Reviews.Content: If you are going to San Francisco, I'd suggest the HOTEL NIKKO and especially one of the Imperial Rooms. Not only is it perfectly located on Mason..minutes from Market & Powell (cable car, shops, Westfield Shopping Centre) but it is a beautiful clean and wonderfully run hotel. Very welcoming and very comfortable. Theres a Starbucks adjoining it for that late night cofee to take back to your room. For a few dollars more, the Imperial Room gives you access to the Imperial Club Room where there is a lovely breakfast selection each morning with internet and all the newspapers of the day. Around 5pm there is a wine & cheese & hot hor d'ouves served. Its on the 23rd floor with a magnificent view and tthe people in charge cater to your every need. I usually pick up my lunch from the buffet to take with me. There's also a nightclub in the hotel where there are an array of visiting performers. Also a beautiful restaurant for fine dining. For Imperial Room members you will get chits for a free breakfast there if you choose. The hotel is immaculate, the staff are extremely friendly & helpful. I asked for my room to be made up every day before noon. Granted!! Also while you are out, they will make up the bed, leave fine chocolates or green tea mints and turn on soft music. It's part of My San Francisco experience whenever I go!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central hotel”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidPenguin
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in San Francisco at the Nikko. It's location is excellent - close to Union Square, cable cars etc. We had a deluxe king room which meant we were on the 16th floor. This was great as we got no noise from the surrounding (very busy) streets. Lower rooms could possibly be quite noisy. We didn't eat in the hotel at all as it was quite expensive and there are plenty of restaurants close by. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravellots2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Francisco over New Years at Nikko and could not find fault. We usually choose smaller boutique hotels but happened upon a great rate at this hotel so decided to give it a try. We were also delighted to find dogs were allowed, which was an added plus. The beds and bedding were extremely comfortable and there were plenty of restaurants and sights nearby... shopping as well... would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, direct city access, but silence. Next time again!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_DE078
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel with very nice service personal making the stay a real holiday. We went late because of a delayed flight but everybody was very pleased and helped us.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: susiejo11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nikko for a week and the room was a good size and comfortable and clean enough. The location is good as it is very central to all the shops, bars and restraunts but as for the hotel itself we found it didnt really suit for a young couple as the bar and music or acts that play there is for an older crowd. We never ate at the hotel at all as it wasnt for us and thought that it was a bit too expensive so if we wanted a quiet night with just a meal and couple of drinks we still had to go out. I think if we went back we would probably stay down at the fishermans wharf. There was also an extra charge on top of the room price if you wanted to use the pool. The good points are the staff are all very friendly and helpful and were more than happy to book trips or sort taxis out for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: andravb
Reviews.Content: The first time here on the recommendation of a relative - perfect location, centrally located. Very quiet and comfortable, excellent staff that accomodate your every wish. Fantastic gym, important to us. Rooms are clean and roomy, view was wonderful, concierge was most delightful, front staff - easy to check in and very friendly. Overall I'd definitely go back and refer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great location, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: PistolPete1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at the Hotel Nikko from 25/6/11 until 29/6/11 and I have to say it was a complete pleasure. The hotel's location is great right next to Union Square. It is close to the BART, the tram and you will never have a problem getting a taxi anywhere. The staff were amazing. On check in they gave us a very detailed map even telling us the no go areas like parts of the Tenderloin district. We arrived on a saturday evening around 7 pm and spoke with the concierge to see if we could get tickets for the Giants baseball at AT & T Park for the next evening. The two concierge's we dealt with Eric and Rick were amazing. They had no problem getting the baseball tickets sorted out at all. On sunday daytime we went to Pier 33 to try and get tickets sorted for an Alcatraz tour. The company who ran the cruises had it booked solid for a week which was way after we would have left. We thought we'd have a chat with Eric and Rick again who went out of their way to sort out an Alcatraz trip with another company. The trip was amazing. I would fully recommend this hotel and will stay here again next time im in San Fransisco. Use the concierge's they are great and tip them well if you get the same good service we got.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: oscmj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nikko for 6 days in July 2011. Upon arrival, we used "Super Shuttle" from SFO which was about a 30 minute ride, efficient and convenient. The Hotel Nikko is located in the Union Square area but very close to the Tenderloin Area (Be very leery of this). Don't be surprised to see the homeless going thru the garbage cans and ash trays in front of the hotel, it's not only prevalent near the hotel but this seems to be the norm instead of the exception in San Francisco. The hotel is very convenient to public transportation, The Westfield Shopping Center, shopping, food and Walgreens. Again, the homeless are all around the city, sleeping in public areas, camped out in front of Walgreens and other stores with signs asking for money, or walking in the shopping area asking for money as you pass, this was a complete turn off for our view of San Francisco and would not recommend it for a family vacation. Not sure why this is accepted, however, it with the very low police presence observed, it gave us a very unsafe, unsettling feeling. As we were walking to the Cable Cars one afternoon, we observed a very dirt homeless woman walking thru the crowd removing her clothes, when she removed her shirt and was topless, another homeless male yelled at her to put her clothes but she continued walking. We did not stick around to see what happened. It was unsightly especially for children present. The city in our view was dirty; areas had strong smells of urine as we walked down Market St to the Pier area. The people of San Francisco are very friendly for the most part, but we encountered several young people (both male and female) on the "F Line" (Transportation to/from Pier areas) on two different trips using strong profanity and vulgarity along with littering and spitting on the Tram Car, we were appalled to see such disregard to their surroundings and the city. Back to the Hotel Nikko, this was a saving grace, the hotel is beautiful, the staff was awesome (friendly and very helpful). We stayed on in an Imperial Club Room (24th floor) which allowed us to take advantage of the evening reception of wine, beer, finger food, cheese and crackers nightly which was a great way to begin your night time activities. The room had a king size bed/pillows that was so comfortable and inviting, the room had all the amenities to make our stay relaxing and cozy. The bathroom was posh and large, we wanted to take the shower home with us, and water pressure was excellent which lacked nothing. The Imperial Club Room came with a continental breakfast (Bagels, pastries, fruit, and cereal along with coffee, tea or juice) which was sufficient to get started in San Fran. We took advantage of the breakfast buffet in the hotelâ€™s restaurant, Anzu, which was superb. They offered a full Japanese Breakfast along with a full American Breakfast with Grilled Salmon, Eggs, Sausage, Bacon, Miso Soup, Lox, Meats etc. (this was a gourmet breakfast). We canâ€™t say enough of the quality of our stay at the Hotel Nikko. Thank you staff and management! Back to the surrounding area, we stayed over 4th of July Weekend. During our stay, there was a shooting two blocks from the hotel (Tenderloin Area) and a Police â€œBARTâ€� Officer shot and killed an armed drunk a few transit stops from the hotel. Union Square is two blocks away (make sure you go in the right direction) where you can catch the open top sightseeing buses, we took the blue bus but I would recommend the red ones as we saw a lot more of them and more frequent pickups. You catch the Cable Cars at Powell and Market along with the â€œFâ€� Line (Tram Car to Fishermanâ€™s Wharf), the Cable Cars are $6 per ride each way and the F and buses are $2 each way. You can buy a weekly transport card (Good discount is you plan on using public transportation) in the visitor center at Powell and Market. The visitor center is down stairs on Powell at Market St. Shopping in the area is no way up to par what you find in New York City. We found some good lunch options on the lower level of the Westfield Shopping Center and they have a Bristol Farms (Market) as well. We will not go in depth here for the sightseeing we did, but highly recommend: Alcatraz (a must, but get tickets on line before you go), Fishermanâ€™s Wharf (Touristy, expensive but fun), Muir Woods (Giant Redwoods) make sure you have enough time to spend there, AT&T Park (saw a Giants Game) and of course the Golden Gate. We saw what we wanted to see in San Francisco and more than we wanted to however, in our future we will go to cities that provide a feeling of a safer, secure environment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mindful_Travels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right downtown a block or two from the main shopping. Loved it!. The staff are pleasant and friendly. The room was nicely situated. The only and I mean the only draw back was the swimming pool. The hotel had invested in the workout and spa area and they are planning to update the swimming pool shortly after we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: kelleytrroy
Reviews.Content: Had a great 2 night stay at the Nikko. We were really surprised with the hotel when we arrived as we got it for a really cheap price and as it was our first time in the US we didn`t know what to expect for such a cheap price It was a really nice hotel very clean and staff were really helpful, The Hotel was in a good location in union square. which made it easy for us to get to see the great city of San Francisco. If we were to go back to San Francisco ever would strongly consider staying at the Nikko again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “convenient downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Siriusguy
Reviews.Content: Choosing the Hotel Nikko for our recent three night stay in San Francisco proved a good decision. Not as big or as busy as some downtown hotels, the location, halfway between Union Square and Nordstrom's, is excellent. The room while not enormous was adequate and in size, and the housekeeping immaculate. Service including for minor problems was very responsive. The on site restaurant, Anzu, proved quite good. Do note that the GARAGE ENTRANCE is on Ellis, not Mason! Routing from the Bay Bridge is very simple, Fifth Street exit, continue on Fifth, which after Market becomes Cyril Magnin, then a left onto Ellis and a quick right into the garage. If you were to enter 190 Ellis into a GPS unit very likely you would get routed correctly. Parking is $45 a day, which, alas, seems typical for this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: elgaz
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at Hotel Nikko a few weeks back whilst travelling around California. It was our first time together in San Francisco, and the first thing that struck me about the hotel was the location - very close to Union Square and the city centre. We couldn't have asked for a better location to be honest, each day it was only a few minutes walk to the square or down the street to get the cable car. To our surprise, we also found when we were leaving that our car hire collection was directly across the street - very handy if you're thinking of staying in SF and then picking up a car to travel on. There is a large shopping plaza less than 5 mins from the hotel, with a cinema, huge eating area and an abundance of assorted shops. We spent a few afternoons here and with the hotel being so close, it was nice not to have to walk a long distance with bags. The Hotel itself is large and very spacious. Our room was clean, well presented, and again spacious. All the usual amenities were present and everything ran smoothly; our room was freshened very day and we had no problems whatsoever. The staff were friendly and courteous, and check-in was quick. The hotel has a restaurant onsite - we didn't actually try this due to the abundance of other local resturants in the vicinity which we wished to try out, but their menu did look enticing! There is a Starbucks downstairs which is part of the hotel lobby, but with an external entrance .... handy for your morning coffee fix before hitting the streets. There is also an Irish bar (Foleys) just a few yards down the street, we ended up in here 2 or 3 times and found it a very busy place with great atmosphere - would recommend it for a few casual drinks. My only gripe with the hotel was lack of free wireless in the rooms - you had to go to the lobby area to pick it up. It seems strange that it wasn't also offered in the rooms, but perhaps this is typical of the hotels in SF city? In other areas we stayed in throughout California, free wi-fi seemed to be the norm. In any event, this was only a minor quibble. All in all, I would highly recommend the hotel and if you're a first time visitor to SF, it really is a fantastic location to use as a base for exploring the city centre area.

Reviews.Title: “Classy for a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: thrall
Reviews.Content: The white marble, multi-level lobby gives the hotel a cool, serene feel (disturbed a bit by in-house radio advertising their restaurant) as conference attendees and businessmen circulate up and down. The hotel has some excellent views from the higher floors (up to the 24th?), though the top couple of floor are Imperial Club rooms offering limited access, free breakfast, free internet, and free use of the pool (other guests incur charges for these). Rooms are reasonably large by San Francisco standards and quite comfortable with elegant, if not inspired, decor. Ours had a walk-in shower in addition to the tub, and the bed was extremely comfortable. We heard no noise from the neighbors, though a smidgen of street noise seeps into rooms on the lower floors (you cannot set the fan to blow constantly to mask the street sounds). Room rates vary extensively by demand around conferences. On the website, they sometimes run specials for little perks like free internet. Parking fees are high everywhere in the city, and the Nikko is no exception, but they'll hold your bags after you check out, allowing you to explore unencumbered on your last day. The neighborhood is good (next to bustling Union Square) and bad (next to the Tenderloin), so be street-smart and enjoy the shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite experience”
Reviews.Author: WilmaWillstone
Reviews.Content: My family celebrated a birthday at the HOTEL NIKKO and were wonderfully appreciated. What an experience. The hotel service is immaculate; from the valet and conciege service to the warm and comfortable accommodations, and Sunday Brunch. Thank you HOTEL NIKKO.

Reviews.Title: “A Positive & Most Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Waenkrisien
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, friendly are my only concerns when travelling overseas and "The Nikko" certainly delivered. As it was only my 11yo daughter & I traveling this time, it had to be special & it was. Found an awesome deal on Expedia for our 6 nights- Deluxe King $148 a night but upgraded for $20 a night to incl. Wi-fi & access to pool. All Staff were fantastic during our stay, especially Julie from Housekeeping. We were able to check-in 2 hours early & Room 2102 had lovely views over Downtown and the most comfortable hotel bed ever. The window ledge was a great spot to soak up the morning sun. Due to a late flight, we were able to extend check-out till 12.30pm and the Bell Man held our bags until 6pm when they ordered a cab for the airport. This was our 2nd trip to San Fran and Union Square is the only place to stay. Everything is literally on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Ruba12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in June 2011. We arrived in the evening, and were driven through the tenderloin district, which is about 5 minutes from the hotel. This was not the best introduction to the hotel. We were told by both the driver and the hotel to stay away from that side of town, especially at night. Check in was fine, although, we had just arrived from 7 days in hawaii, and the response of the receptionist was, "what are you doing here! you should have stayed there!" he was however very helpful and friendly and check in was fine. The hotel looks very 1980's, but is clean and functional. the rooms have basic things included, nothing to really write home about in terms of style or views. Even though the hotel is near the tenderloin district, it is well placed for union square, if you walk in the right direction, and there are plenty of restaurants and takeaways on the same street, and two starbucks, one in the hotel and one across the road. I would say stay here if you are on business, wouldnt really recommend it for a holiday, it just doesnt have that kind of feel. I would say find a hotel near fishermans wharf if you are holidaying, much more to see and do there.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: mojave_ben
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting. I'd stay again if at a conference but probably would not choose the Nikko myself unless I got a good deal The room was in good shape but not the biggest - fine for me solo but even with two might have been a tad crowded. Maid service was excellent. Bed was good. Room was quiet with respect to internal hotel noise but there was a fair amount of street noise even up on the 14th floor. Check in was slow. Other interactions with the staff were fine. Location is fine though there are a lot of tourists here and the Tenderloin, with drunks and street people, starts a block or two from the hotel - doesn't bother me much but does not add to the atmosphere. Powell St. BART is very close by. Lots of small restaurants and fast food places as well. Not too far from Chinatown and I enjoyed walking down Market to the Embarcadero. What didn't I like? Mostly the internet connection. It was usually slow, often dismal, and from time to time (like 6AM) quite speedy. Just not a big enough pipe out of the hotel. I'd have been annoyed if I had paid for such (was included in my conference room rate). The room ventilation was sub par. Most hotels have a setting where you can just run the fan all the time and mask noise with the fan sounds. In this hotel, if you set the fan to "ON" setting it runs for a while, and then shuts off. Then it will go off and on, apparently with the cooling only - that is what the "AUTO" setting should do. And the maid always turned the AC off - meant I'd come back to a boiling sunny room. The hotel sent a "hope everything is OK" emali after the first night. Cute, but they never replied when I asked about the fan. I was glad I have my own micro white noise source. The bathroom was fine and I sort of liked the "glass box" shower. But, despite the standard exhortation to hang your towels if you did not want them replaced, almost no towel rack space. I wash clothes in my room and it was hard to find places to dry them. So I'd call this a nice place with a few flaws, none real bad, a good place to stay if you get a bargain rate.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: Happywinetaster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and modern. It is conveniently located to many popular attractions. The staff was helpful and friendly. Metro, bus and trolleys all within a block or two. Within walking distance to Chinatown and all the great shopping in the Union Square area! We would definitely stay here again when returning to San Francisco. Great Irish Pub on the opposite corner and Starbucks in the lobby. Con: Parking was pricey at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High class service”
Reviews.Author: nothankyou123
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptional in service and smiles. My questions were pleasantly and thoroughly answered, and I was always greeted with a smile--even when I went out at 4:45am for my regular morning runs. The room was meticulous, and homey. Overall, the theme was simple elegance--both in decor and professional manner. I will choose Hotel Nikko whenever I am in San Francisco, and will choose to stay there in other locations as well.

Reviews.Title: “I loved Hotel Nikko”
Reviews.Author: nmeaux
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with my boyfriend for his birthday for two nights, The hotel was wonderful and the staff were great. We got the parking included in our room rate which was nice. Also, internet was free because we got a Nikko room, that was nice as well. The pool and sauna were outstanding!!!!! The hotel is close to union square and shopping. The Anzu restaurant was also very nice and delicious. I would absolutley recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but service needs some work”
Reviews.Author: Choncygirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, but be forewarned that several policies have changed such as the pet policy. Whereas it used to be free to bring a pet (you just needed to sign a waiver) they now charge $50 per night PLUS taxes and fees for each pet. Also, make sure you keep a receipt handy if you booked this hotel from a discount site-otherwise the front desk may not honor it.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice”
Reviews.Author: Kainoa1003
Reviews.Content: Travelling with children, this hotel is just the best choice we could have made ! It's close to everything : shopping, restaurants, cable car rides, street car stops to the pier 39, Movie theaters...Clean, safe and friendly staff, we really loved it and we'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, efficient hotel, good location and excellent health club”
Reviews.Author: CaptainScarlet75
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights. Advised upon arrival to upgrade our room to kingsize which we did. Right decision as the room was fabulous. Large bathroom, huge comfy bed and a great view to the east towards the financial district and Union Square. Housekeeping was faultless, concierge was extremely helpful, trendy lobby and the health club was great with a lovely pool, nice jacuzzi and clean changing rooms (if a bit on the small side). Location is pretty good as it was only two blocks (2 minutes walk) from Union Square and there are numerous diners and eating places very close by. We used the streetcars (F-Line) extensively to travel around (to Fisherman's Wharf, Ferry Building and to The Castro) as the the lines were ridiculously long for the cable cars. Only small point is that Hotel Nikko is only round the corner from The Tenderloin district which is an area to be avoided after dark. This didn't casue us any problems whatsover but it's just a note of caution. Overall, Hotel Nikko is to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JAHPITT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 days in San Francisco and loved the Hotel Nikko. We arrived at 10:00 AM to find our room ready. Actually several were available and the clerk allowed us to pick the floor. The room was very modern and super clean. The best feature was the large bathroom with separate tub and shower. The pool and exercise areas were wonderful. Concierge was very helpful in getting tickets and providing tourist information. We rented a car directly in the hotel. Overall a great experience and the price was an excellent bargain for a hotel with all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, consistent quality”
Reviews.Author: Zog13
Reviews.Content: I was attending a business conference. 5 nights, 18th floor on North side. *Room: clean, quite, no problems, quiet (important), nice closet safe, AC works as expected, *View: I go for the north-side, slightly better then bay-view (east-side, in my opinion). Forget the west or south sides, you will be looking into other hotel windows. *Front Desk Staff: patient, super responsive to request to move due to noisy neighbor. Very convienent Starbucks at sidewalk level. Internet access was MUCH faster this visit. they must have upgraded their routers. Downside: upon check-in asked to look at other rooms, got typical response "our hotel is booked tonight, no other rooms are available, try tomorrow morning". Typical for hotels.Given the price, type and size of room, location in city, it's a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sanfrancisco”
Reviews.Author: ann17_11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nikko is a lovely hotel, staff dont acknowldge you, unless you approach them and ask a question, we were not far from Union Sq, it is a Buisness Centre, we did not eat in the hotel, we were surprised to see so many homless sleeping on the pavements, America is a country i thought would look after its people, i did not see any day centres where the homeless could go into to get food, we wished we had stayed in Fishermans Wharfe, we went there every day on the famous cable car, its got a lovely market with fresh fruit etc, we also booked a trip online before we went there, to Alcatraz which was great, the trip also included a tour of San Francisco, I would recomend San Francisco Fishermans Wharfe

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: UltimateB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. We were a block and a half away from Union Square and a 2 blocks away from the Westfield shopping center. Housekeeping did a great job in tidying up our room every day. There was a Starbucks connected to the hotel that had free wifi, which was great. Staff were friendly and the concierge was very helping in giving us directions. A Walgreens was also a half block away so we could get water, snacks, etc. The only downside was that there is no free wifi in the rooms, which was too bad. We just used the Starbucks downstairs when we needed to look something up. The room that we were in had a single queen bed and was a small as well. Just be careful not to walk too too far west, as the Tenderloin area is close by and there are some sketchy people there.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible property”
Reviews.Author: SueLa27
Reviews.Content: My husband and two sons (ages 13 and 16) stayed at the Hotel Nikko Memorial Day weekend. The hotel truly surpassed our expectations. The hotel staff members are professional, friendly, and courteous. They provided us with an early check-in, late check-out, and a free upgrade to a room with 2 queen beds (we had reserved 2 double beds). The hotel location is perfect, with easy walking access to a variety of restauarnts, shops, and the Westfield Mall. The room was large, well-appointed, comfortable and contemporary. When we had difficulty with the TV remote control, a staff member arrived within minutes with a replacement. We did not eat in the hotel restaurants, order room service, or use the spa and swimming pool, so I cannot comment on those amenities, but based on the overall experience, I'm sure they are excellent as well! I can't say enough about the Hotel Nikko. We will definitely stay there on our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,small and clean rooms, charge you for everything”
Reviews.Author: nkf00
