Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nikko over memorial week end.the location is great,close to shopping, restaurants. Rooms are v small, we had to pay extra 20 dollars plus taxes per night to be upgraded to a king bed but rooms are still small.u have to pay addition $ 10 to use pool which is ridiculous and valet is $45 plus taxes. Very expensive for an already expensive hotel. Very clean rooms and they gladly accommodate us with a complementary fridge for our baby's milk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey !”
Reviews.Author: Iamsuperk
Reviews.Content: Long overdue review for the Nikko ... I had a room on the 16th floor with all the usual amenities you'd expect. The bathroom was a brilliant size with seperate shower stall and bath - excellent. The king bed was very comfortable and there was no road noise. A lot of the room showed wear & tear, old carpet, scuffed furniture etc which I didn't expect in this price bracket. I found front desk check in unhelpful and surly. Also shocked that despite having a fully paid voucher for the stay they booked the same amount again (over $800USD) to my visa debit card to cover incidentals (beware if you use a debit visa, my bank assures me this shouldn't be necessary) which seemed excessive. Failed to see any evidence of a Japanese theme in the rooms other than the Anzu (?) restaurant. The tv in the room wouldn't work, I informed front desk to get it fixed several times as I was leaving for tours / meals out but they kept telling me to see them when I was back and they'd arrange it then - not good enough.. by the time I got in late from excursions I just wanted a drink and the tv working before sleeping and not waiting around for someone to come up. Overall given the price I was disappointed and would try somewhere else next time. I would like to point out that the staff at the front door were excellent and always willing to help.... perhaps put them on reception !!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: FamilyJamaica
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms but need a little bit update. It is not that cheap, so one would expect top quality. Location is excellent, but there are lot's of homeless people around the hotel that will approach you the second you exit lobby. It would be helpful if hotel stuff takes care of that. Service if fare, they don't pumper their guests, but you get everything that you ask for. My only complain are the "hidden" or "extra charges" that you have to pay. First, mini-bar has sensors, which means that even if you shuffle things around and move something to make room for your own items, they will charge you. Of course, that is written on some card that you should notice, but most of the time you don't, so you are "surprised" with "refreshment charges" when you take care of the bill. I have to say that they "wave" those charges that you actually didn't make, but why do you have to be stressed about it, what is the purpose of sensors anyway if they trust you that you didnâ€™t use anything? Then, you have to pay extra for the use of gym and pool. It is only 10$, but it is annoying. If they charge $250-350/night, and you choose this hotel because of it's amenities, how much money do they make by charging extra 10$/stay for the gym? By the way, gym is amazing, one of the best in hotels I've seen. And the internet......$15/day?!? There is Starbucks in the lobby where you get internet for free, or for the price of cup of coffee. Overall, very good hotel and very pleasant stay in San Francisco. I would go there again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “perfect downtown location”
Reviews.Author: GailSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: very modern, very comfortable, exceptional service. there is a $10 charge for pool/jacuzzi use--with the price of the room, it should be included. very close to shopping, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel nice rooms crap staff.”
Reviews.Author: DunmoreEast
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel nice rooms. Staff at reception were to say the least useless and ignorant. The Conceirge who's name I think was Ben was excellent in fact my advice to this guy would be leave before his reputation is tarnishs with the rst of the staff being so bad. Bar staff seem to be about 18 and havent heard of most drinks and if your looking for something as complicated as a latte then your out of luck. Apart from that the hotel is well located very near the center of the city and close to all major transport if you dont mind moving left or right every ten seconds to avoid every bum and tramp begging for money. Good restaurants in city center within 5 minutes from hotel again if you dont mind brushing past all the bums.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DarrenWh
Reviews.Content: Booked through an on-line agency for Nikko Floor room and very happy with the price. Due to the Amtrak California Zephyr not arriving until gone 2am, I didn't actually get to the hotel until around 3.30. Knowing I would be late, I called ahead to them the courtesy of an update. On arrival, I half expected the room to have been released. I was greeted by the night receptionist with extreme politeness and even got the chance to practice a little Japanese with her. I was given a complimentary upgrade to a Japanese Suite on the 24th floor. On opening the door, I thought I was in the wrong room. To call it a suite is an understatement. All it was missing was a kitchen and it would be a comfortable apartment. A massive bedroom with 2 kings and about 50 pillows... Add a lounge area with sofa and chaise lounge for the huge window. My view was looking along O'Farrell to Market St. The bedroom had the same view and instead of curtains, was graced by Shoji screen doors. The real star though, was the bathroom. set out in all black marble, it's a full wet room for the shower and massive soak tub. The floor has wooden Sunoko to keep you above the wet floor. I could have spent all day in there!! Overall a truly fantastic stay that provided me with 'Subarashee Omoide'

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Friendly Staffs”
Reviews.Author: MaiCho
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went down to SF for the Easter long weekend. We came across the promotion deal online and honestly I didn't expect much at first after reading the reviews in regards to the room sizes, etc. On the other hand, my dad who is a frequent traveler to Japan has recommended Hotel Nikko to us, he has reassured us that we wouldnt be disappointed at Hotel Nikko chain services - and he was absoulutely right. First- very convinent location, we got the map from SFO and took the Bart to DT Powell. The hotel was just couple blocks away and the prime location just made us love the hotel right away. They have assigned us the room early, staffs were friendly, but be aware that they will try upselling you with various upgrades, or accesses to the hotel amenities.We were assigned to a one king bedroom, and the size is okay, providing the location of hotel and the price, we definitely are satisfied with whats provided. Staffs are extremely friendly and helpful in providing directions, deals, etc. Bathroom are big and clean, except we were little disappointed that over the course of 4 nts, the housekeeper has not changed our toileretes and at the end of our fourth night, we were kinda running out of shampoo and conditioner. The concieges is extremely friendly, without realizing the BART doesnt operate till 8am on Sunday, they managed to help us arrange a last-minute shuttle that came ontime on Sunday at 5 am. Overall its a really pleasant stay, shops and 5 stars restaurants are nearby. My boyfriend and I have already planned for another trip to NAPA/SF Bay area this fall. And we would definitely stay at Hotel Nikko again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic lobby, okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: LtDan
Reviews.Content: If you judged this hotel by your first look at the lobby you'd think it was a spectacular 4-star. However, judging by the rooms it must have been an old Sheraton or something...they're fairly unremarkable and look a bit dated. Still, everything was very clean, the service was good and the location of the hotel isn't bad...quite close to Mission Street, but also a quick walk to Union Square and lots of restaurants. Judging by the name, the restaurant (Anzu) and the clientele, they obviously cater to a lot of Japanese tourists. They even present room keys with both hands and a slight bow...nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here if You Want to Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingThruEurope
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by mentioning the good things: Hotel has a good location close to Union Square; our special occasion was recognized by a box of malt chocolate balls waiting for us in our room; we received a nice Deluxe King on the 19th floor overlooking the city; the pool was nice; the housekeeper was very nice. We were so excited to be staying at this hotel until we tried to sleep. One word of advice- stay away if you like to get a peaceful sleep! You can hear every single word, footstep, and toilet flush from other guests. This hotel does not have any kind of noise proofing or sound installation. When complaints were made to the hotel about this, they were not proactive in the least bit. Because we did not get much sleep at this hotel, we will likely return to the Palace on our next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SJorgenson25
Reviews.Content: I want to write this review because of Eric the concierge. I believe he is specifically the afternoon/night concierge. He was wonderful and really helped make our trip amazing. We were in San Francisco for our two year wedding anniversary and needed to find a place for dinner. I'm a fairly picky eater, so it can be tough to find something I like. Eric spent 20 minutes finding out what we like and making recommendations. I turned down a few because of my pickiness. (Poor guy!) He didn't seem to mind and was still just as pleasant to work with. He eventually recommend and made reservations for us at this amazing small, intimate Italian restaurant in Nob Hill. It was perfect! He also had mentioned that Alcatraz was sold out for almost the rest of our stay. I believe there were two time slots left that we could make during our stay. Had he not mentioned it, we would have missed it. We hadn't taken into account that it was Easter weekend and there were a lot of people in town visiting family. Eric sold us our tickets right there and saved our butts! Thanks for making our anniversary trip such a success Eric!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business & Leisure”
Reviews.Author: Lisa1172
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Nikko for the third time last week & am finally getting around to writing a review. I've selected it twice for business trips & once for a romantic weekend with my hubby. It was perfect for both occasions. I love the bar, the front desk staff is very friendly & the location is great. It's close to Chinatown & Union Square & Market Street are right there for fantastic shopping. This last trip we got basic rooms for $149 which was a fabulous deal. I usually pay more for a higher floor view room which are more spacious but for a one night stay the basic room was just right. Parking is expensive but that is the same at any SF hotel I've ever stayed. All in all, I love this property. Everyone seems happy to be there - from the other guests to the staff. The beds are comfortable & the bathrooms are nice. A very good choice for a City stay, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: nosaj65
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit tio Hotel Nikko. I managed to get a great rate and i was so happy to be returning. The hotel is in a great location. Modern, up to date efficient .comfortable beds with lovely linen. fantastic facilities ie gym, pool and the resturant is super. I hope i can return on my next trip to San Francisco in September

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: sd123074
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review because I've never been that impressed and have stayed at many nice places. For the price and the location, Nikko is the best. They have a great gym and pool, huge rooms by SF norms, and everyone was beyond nice. This hotel just has something "special" about it - hard to put your finger on, but definitely a great place that I'll return to.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Clevelandrocks07
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. I luckily got a great deal on the room, so I can't comment on the value, but everything is high end. The rooms are very large, the beds comfortable, huge bathrooms with separate bathtubs and showers. The staff is friendly (although some struggle with English) and very courteous. The fitness room and pool (extra $10 per room) have to be one of the best in San Francisco, both very large and clean. If you can afford this place, I would definitely recommend it. If you plan to spend most of your time sightseeing, you probably won't get the full value of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty ordinary hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Richard3150
Reviews.Content: We stayed att this hotel thinking it was in a great location in the centre of San Francisco. The location was just fine but the hotel was very ordinary. We rated it as average but it was getting closer to poor. The room was quite small but well furnished and adequate for a short stay. No breakfast included in our price and the hotel charges $15 per day for wifi. Wow were had become used to free wifi in everything from hotels, trains, buses and fast food outlets so this charge was just plain exorbitant. Wouldn't bother with this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “not bad but no individuality”
Reviews.Author: OverworkedUnderpaid
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here after a trip to Napa. I had a double room but it was pretty small given some of the other rooms I stayed in whilst in the area. Room - ever so slightly shabby. I am probably being uber picky, but I spotted some stains on the carpets, my wardrobe door was hanging from one hinge, one light in the bathroom stopped working on my last day. Nothing earth shattering but it is not pristine. Bed - comfortable. More pillows per square foot than should be safe in such a small space! Bathroom - initially had a problem with water pressure, but this was sorted out as soon as I complained to reception. Service - the reception staff and concierge were extremely helpful and courteous. A lot of Japanese visitors patronise this hotel, and I imagine they are pretty hot on this sort of detail. The hotel definitely gets this right. Gym - 10 Dollars for unliimited use during my stay. I didn't visit the pool/spa but it did look very good. The gym itself was very well equipped (about 6 treadmills, numerous other cardio machines and plenty of weights machines/freeweights/swiss balls/stretch area etc). There is a Starbucks underneath the hotel and I did make use of it every day (!) The hotel is very well situated, being about 3 mins walk from Union Square, Macy's and Westfield. It is 3 mins to the streetcar terminus and very easy to get around to pretty much anywhere you like. I even walked back from the AT+T stadium one evening - took me about half an hour (walking quickly). Hard to fault this hotel, but it IS just a hotel. If you are after a special experience then look for something more boutique.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Beware of BellBoy/Taxi Mafia”
Reviews.Author: zepza
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. Great locarion and the rooms are small but decent. Flat creen tv and the bathrooms are large and more than ample. The buffet is not worth the 22 dollars. My biggest complaint was upon leaving the hotel. Checked out and had a few hours to kill before my late afternoon flight. Lefy my baggage with the bellboys and they asked if I would require a taxi, I said yes but i would be back around 2:30 PM. I arrived back at 2:50 PM and much to my surprise, they had my bags already loaded into the taxi. After a 5 dollar tip to the bellboy, i noticed that the cabbie had already rung up 9 bucks in waiting time. Furthermore, I saw the cabbie and bellboy do the ol handshake and noticed an excgange of currency. They should have waited for me to get back before organizing the taxi, afer all, there is a taxi stande with at least 5 cabs waiting. Fooled me once but never twice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but still in good shape.”
Reviews.Author: crackerback2000
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel; great downtown location. Parking expensive. Very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Incredible Upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: MVKMom
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place in San Francisco to stay with my family. We are a family of four and wanted a suite that had enough space to have some privacy in the main room with the ability to fit a cot in the extra room with a sleeper sofa. We found the suites at the Nikko and decided they had the most space for the best value. When I called to ask a question about the room, the hotel manager was incredibly helpful and proceeded to provide us with a room upgrade at no additional charge. When we arrived, we had been upgraded again to the Imperial Suite!! I can't speak about the other rooms but this upgrade was incredible. We had access to the Imperial Club, which was great for the morning hours and wine/snacks in the evening. The staff was helpful and polite. Work-out room was fair and the pool was closed for remodeling. It was great to have a Starbucks in the building and I thought it would be an added bonus that Enterprise Rental Car was located on the property. However, the Enterprise service was HORRIBLE! Took us 50 minutes to get our car and when it arrived, was completely empty. Would definitely recommend the Nikko - especially in the Imperial Room :) - just rent your car somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “The lobby & entrance looked so much fancier than the rooms...”
Reviews.Author: LESERLEE23
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, I was able to pretty much walk everywhere we had to sight see. Although, when we first walked in, we were so amazed of how nice the entrance and lobby area looked I guess it really set our high expectations. Unfortunately, when we got into our room we were a bit disappointed by its presentation. It was very bland and small, but the bathroom was very nice. You should go to the top floor and take pictures, they give a very nice view of the downtown area. Overall, it was an okay hotel for what we paid for...

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again, anytime.”
Reviews.Author: CentralWisco
Reviews.Content: I felt safe. It was clean. The staff was very polite. These are the 3 things that are most important to me, in order of importance, in selecting a place to stay. It was reasonably priced and in a great location as well. My only complaint is that they didn't have Mountain Dew in the gift shop, which was probably for my own good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel right by Union Square”
Reviews.Author: marathonbird
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd visit to the Union Square section of San Francisco and I felt that overall this hotel was very nice and wonderfully located. My only complaint was that it was a bit pricey (though with the AAA discount I was able to save a bit, and get a room on the Nikko floor which came with free wi-fi) and the on-site restaurant was much too expensive to even consider. Also, I would have preferred to have had use of the gym included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “A stunningly beautiful hotel with a friendly vibe...”
Reviews.Author: KDDay
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter this hotel you sense the calm elegance and hear the sound of water flowing over marble. You are welcomed by each staff person you pass and the front desk person makes you feel like you are a very special guest. In less then 5 minutes, we were checked in and on our way to our gorgeous room with a view all the way to the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: nancyb3770
Reviews.Content: Loved the friendly staff and even more so my room- specially my bed- very, very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: weejim
Reviews.Content: Apart from the price variation - one night 150 one 249 - I cannot fault the Nikko if you want to stay near the heart of things in SF. Got a very nice room great bathroom and shower, bed was comfy and room was quiet. If I was nitpicking , reception staff could be more attentive but on the whole it was a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff and Facilities A Diamond in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Toolecreek
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in two years and we were even more impressed by the friendly staff and quality of the accomodations. Centrally located this hotel has access to everything you need in San Francisco. Walking or using the local transportation it was easy to get around town and see the sights and shop. The restaurants and Bar in the hotel are easily 5 star quality. We will return to this location again and again because of the level of service and value we received.

Reviews.Title: “okay but showing its age”
Reviews.Author: TinQC
Reviews.Content: This hotel appears to have been very nice in it's 'hay-day' but could stand some updating... it's beginning to show wear and tear. Our first room was not what we requested and were upgrade to a suite. The suite was nice but the pull out sofa was pretty uncomfortable. The lobby also has a '70s feel to me. The location is great and all in all we enjoyed our stay although the hotel is not as luxurious as I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ATNT
Reviews.Content: Poor Rooms, too small I need it an upgrade to have a bigger room and the bed was still small and very noisy. Not worth staying to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline found this treasure for us!”
Reviews.Author: Atticus38
Reviews.Content: I entered "Four Star" when it asked for hotels, and indicated "western" Union Square. We agreed to $135. plus $30. in taxes. Behold the Nikko Hotel. First time to stay there and it was lovely. We will certainly go back on our own. We frequented the jazz show right on site and enjoyed the unique ambiance created by flowing rivers of water. The front desk was helpful and considerate, and generally we had a great time. The room was small, but then we got it for a song, and it was perfect for just an overnight stay. Everything was clean and quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A romantic weekend we won't forget”
Reviews.Author: homeinthewater
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, our experience with Hotel Nikko SF was a pleasure. The staff was friendly, courteous, and thoughtful throughout our stay. Often times it's the little things that count the most, and Hotel Nikko pays attention to them. A bit weary from several hours worth of flight delays, being greeted with "happy anniversary!" by the front desk upon arrival really served to boost our spirits. Finding a complimentary bottle of champagne and a card in our room to mark the special occasion was merely a beginning to the personalized care we received all weekend. On two occasions, we opted to eat in our room. Both experiences with room service - breakfast and dinner - were virtually flawless. The food arrived on time, was precisely what we had ordered, and was an appropriate temperature (not to mention delicious!). I was still asleep when our morning meal arrived and my partner later told me that the gentleman who came to deliver it caught on to that fact quickly and went to great pains not to wake me from my peaceful slumber. Our other dinner with the hotel was at their restaurant, Anzu, where we had an equally exceptional experience: fantastic food and exemplary service. After leaving the Do Not Disturb sign on our door for a couple of days, housekeeping called to ask if we needed anything. They did an excellent job making sure that our needs were met while respecting our privacy. And when I developed an allergic reaction to a piece of new piece of clothing I didn't wash before wearing it, the front desk staff worked efficiently to help me get some Benadryl in my system quickly. In addition to the wonderful staff and food, we enjoyed several amenities offered by Hotel Nikko. We stayed in a King Room on the Nikko Floor and our bathroom was impressive, with a separate shower and tub. As two women who tend toward the femme side, an additional vanity outside of the bathroom was quite welcome! Our bed was very comfortable and there were no disturbing noises at night or during the day. Since water is one of our favorite places to be, it was a given that we would try out the pool. Although it was a bit small and somewhat shallow - 4.5 feet on the deep end - we had fun and were even able to swim a few laps. There is an Enterprise on-site and they were able to quickly pull up our reservation for a car. The Enterprise staff also deserves a huge shout out here. Not only were they incredibly friendly and helpful at the start of our rental, they generously stayed an extra few minutes past their closing time as we desperately weaved through San Francisco traffic on our way back to the hotel. A couple of important notes: 1) It turns out that our visit was just prior to a 6-week renovation of the pool area - it's now closed and scheduled to reopen on April 4, 2011. According to a notice posted on the wall in the locker rooms, Hotel Nikko arranged for its guests to have the use of both an indoor and an outdoor pool at neighboring hotels during this time. 2) While the in-room stereo system was a delight, it didn't have any built-in support for playing music off of an iPod or other MP3 player. We came prepared with both a "mini stereo to dual RCA" adapter cable and - equally importantly - knowledge of how to connect it to the stereo. The hotel staff might have both the equipment and the know-how if you don't, but better safe than sorry. (The stereo did have a CD player, if you'd rather go that route.) Overall, our vacation was everything we were hoping it would be and more, thanks in large part to the fabulous staff at Hotel Nikko. We are excited to return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, well-equipped, great location, personable staff”
Reviews.Author: meramec44
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights and found the hotel very clean and the staff very helpful. I only ate one meal in the hotel restaurant but it was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: helloteethLondon
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weeks stay at Hotel Nikko. Great location for shopping, transport, restaurants and tourist attractions. The hotel staff were very friendly, efficient and informative. The room was very clean with a great view, we had nothing to complain about. The gym swimming pool and sauna are there if you want to use them for an extra $10 for 2 people for your entire stay. The service was excellent from booking through to check-out, luggage storage and ordering a taxi to the airport. Would definitely recommend this hotel, as it is in a great location with good facilities and service.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: JohnTravelNewYork
Reviews.Content: Bait and switch. Book a room, prepaid for it and arrived. They said the room we already paid for was going to cost extra. I even had email proof with me. The manager is an [--]. I was totally calm and professional. They would not honor what we paid for. Needless we will be following up with someone else to get a refund. Do not bother to stay here. There are plenty of other places that are probably honest.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Irmgard82
Reviews.Content: The Nikko is in an excellent location near the cable cars, BART and busy downtown SF. My "Petite Queen" was perfect for a single traveler and even OK for a second person. Very helpful staff: the bellhop helped me set-up my computer and the concierge gave me great advice on travel to the airport and even printed out my boarding pass. An oasis in a very busy area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, very comfortable room and bed, great food served at the conference”
Reviews.Author: sheila155019
Reviews.Content: Definitley very good value, Would certainly stay at Hotel Nikko again and recommend it to my friends

Reviews.Title: “perfect for downton location”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang_Paris
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 nights at NIKKO for conference at The Moscone Center (10min walking distance); polite and rapid service team -from reception to housekeeping; booking via conference organizer for 186$ +tax / night which included wireless internet access working fine (except one morning cut-off due to problems at provider AT&T); breakfast at Starbucks convenient; I did not try out hotel restaurant as pricing is excessive compared to all the possibilities in the surroundings. 5min walk to Bart / Cable car station (Powel) You do not need a car if you stay in the city (parking is possible but expensive) - use 7 day pass for MUNI (26$) if you stay longer; the room was clean, comfortable bed; unfortunately curtain was dirty and damaged which is not necessary in this type of hotel; TV an HiFi was good quality (they even provide two Cds of music for CD player); room bar fridge well equipped but again too expensive; better buy outside and ask housekeeping to empty fridge (see other comments). The 10$ fee for fitness center is worth the price as it gives you access to pool, well equipped fitness center, sauna and steam room. Use of business center possible, but again overpriced (8$ to print one page!!!)

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!! More 5*”
Reviews.Author: Smilesx
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after a long flight from London, on arrival we found the check in lady to be very friendly and indeed very helpful, explaining about our room, and asking if we needed any advice on where to eat or where to go. Also handed us a map of the area and city, which was very helpful through-out our stay. Our room was totally marvellous the views over looked Union Square, the city and Bay Bridge in the distance. The room was very clean, in-fact spotless every day the sheets were changed and clean towels left, we also had a turn down service which every night mints or chocolates were left, lamp left on for our return. The wifi was good for keeping in touch with the family back home. The bathroom was huge with a separate shower, with two shower heads, we really could not fault this hotel at all, and would highly recommend it to all. Through-out our stay we asked reception a few questions and always found all the staff to be friendly and have a very responsive and professional approach, always greeting us by our surname which was wonderful, certainly made us feel special, rather than just another customer. We found the location to be perfect, a very short walk to Union Square and Market Street where we were able to pick up trams and transport for the rest of the city. We have travelled to many places through-out the world but have to say for us, this is one of the best hotels we have stayed in. Thank you Hotel Nikko for making our delayed honeymoon and anniversary so very special.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for business - and I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Content: There was a mess-up with the booking (they didn't have me), but the staff were apologetic and made things right as soon as possible. The room was terrific: large, comfortable for work, well maintained, quiet despite the inner city location, and with very spacious and comfortable 3-room bathroom. It also has a good lobby lounge, bar, entertainment and restaurant. The location was within minutes of Union Square and the cable car terminus, and was very convenient. I would stay here again even if travelling for holiday.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel if you have a dog!”
Reviews.Author: mreily
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased that Hotel Nikko allows dogs. Not only is it a high class hotel that allows dogs but they don't charge you a massive fee for having your dog- there is no pet fee.! As a pet owner, I don't appreciate any hotel penalizing me for traveling with a member of my family. Hotel Nikko respects that a pet is a member of your family and therefore I respect their hotel. The location is great just off Union Square. The hotel is very clean. We were upgraded to a great corner view room for just $15. Every staff member was professional and very friendly. We will stay at this hotel again whether or not we have our dog with us. We also got the Silver Bells package which included valet parking (in and out all you want) in the price of the room. A great value in itself. No bother with parking the car at an outside garage or that additional expense.

Reviews.Title: “excelent hotel in great location staffed by friendly helpful personnel”
Reviews.Author: Proudad
Reviews.Content: Very close to diversified shopping near Union Square, mall nearby on Market Street, Chinatown a couple of blocks away, many restaurants nearby. We enjoyed the indoor pool and the excelent breakfast buffet. Dodn't notice any noise that would wake us up or keep us awake

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel at a three star price”
Reviews.Author: Opa-of-four
Reviews.Content: Great staff- great accommodations- central location- we will back!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the shopping district”
Reviews.Author: siw713
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to San Francisco to celebrate the new year and decided to stay somewhere new and Hotel Nikko did not disappoint. The staff was courteous and the rooms were very clean and spacious. We loved that it was near lots of great restaurants and shopping. Would highly recommend it. Free Internet use. Indoor pool in San Francisco is a great amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: aek82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with my partner in a Imperial Club 1 bed room. The perks of the imperial club room are worth it -especially if you plan on eating the breakfast buffet using the internet, or having some wine/snacks in the evenings. For the few extra dollars each night, its not a bad deal at all considering the cost of meals in the area. Pros: *The location is near numerous transportation options such as the subway, cable car, bus stops, and trolley. Stops for either the cable car or trolley can take you to the ferry station or the Fisherman's Warf. Very close to financial district and plenty of brand name shopping is in the area. * In general the rooms were quite spacious. Bathrooms didn't feel cramped at all and were well lit. Bed felt just right. The CD player in the room was also a nice touch. Internet speeds were decent and did not experience any timeouts on my connection. Flat screen TV was more then adequate. *Hot water and plumbing in general worked fine. HVAC unit was quiet. We used the heater most of the time and it worked great. * Maids kept the rooms clean. No shortage of clean towels. * There is a plethora of car rental places around this hotel. There's an Enterprise in the hotel building. If that doesn't meet your needs, there's a Hertz and Dollar across the street from the hotel. * Service was good. A fridge was wheeled out to us free of charge for storing water and other drinks we purchased. * Our floor was very quiet. Did not hear any neighbors during our stay. * Checking in and out of the hotel was quick and painless. * Concierge was very helpful in getting our boarding passes printed out. * Breakfast buffet is decent. I thoroughly enjoyed it every morning. Cons: * Parking is expensive. However, there is a parking garage across the street from the hotel that is much cheaper. * Pool is shallow, run down. The pool area needs to be revamped. The lining that keeps the water in the pool is faded and the tiles in the pool area need to be scrubbed for mildew and dirt. It just looks like this area hasn't been maintained well for such a nice hotel. Pool is also very shallow - about 3-4 ft deep at most. All in all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but beware of charges”
Reviews.Author: mstsc
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for staying in downtown. Had booked through their website and opted for the upgrade after the booking process. When I checked in, the upgrade price had changed to 40$. I mentioned to the check in staff that I was told about the price and would like to pay that price but she said, this is the price, nothing can be done. I accepted the prices because I just got in from Crescent City, CA, and just wanted to rest. Rooms didnt have house slippers and bathrobes and called housekeeping. That service was fast and good. Great view and good rest in the rooms. Eventhough the rooms were smaller, the bathrooms were better in size. Checking out was another issue. I was helped by Mr Tashima and I had JAL coupons as a form of payment. As I had booked with the "parking" package, I thought all was included. But I had to pay for additional fees for parking. I refused to pay the additional fees because that was not agreed upon booking or at checking in. I had to convinced Mr Tashima with printouts and emails to remove the charges. He agreed. When converting my JAL coupons( Yen <-> USD ), he made a calculation error and I mentioned to him. He was shaking his head and was rather rude and mentioned that this was how the calculation was done. I asked him for the exchange rate he had and showed him on my cell phone that the value he got was wrong. He finally accepted after he tried on his calculator a few times. I also mentioned that I do get my mileage points for this stay and he said, "we will see if its accepted by the Airline". I mentioned to him that the website said this stay will be credited by JAL. Its 2011 and I have not seen it and the Airlines said they have not recieved any such point credits. Overall stay was great minus the check in staff.

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything”
Reviews.Author: The_Blonde_Beach
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, huge room, excellent helpful staff, fantastic breakfasts, fabulous entertainer at the piano bar, what more could you want? Other hotels could take lessons on how to operate. Oh by the way, good value too for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “LAP OF LUXURY”
Reviews.Author: MMPJMH
Reviews.Content: We spent four bone-chilling days in The City right after Christmas -- and what a pleasure it was to be able to dive into a heated pool, jacuzzi, sauna and steam room. We popped for the extra money to be on the Imperial Lounge floor, which included free Internet-connected computers, health club privileges, continental breakfast (lavish, not your Travel Lodge "Bear Bites"), wine/beer reception each evening with lots of excellent cheeses and crackers. And, if you wanted, you could skip the continental breakast and have a breakfast buffet (American or Japanese) feast in the hotel restaurant. It was treatment fit for a king... except for one little mishap: on Day 3, Housekeeping forgot to drop in. Not to worry, we opted for just some new towels. Probably a good idea to spot someone on your way out and remind them when you will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Wonderful Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: jaeggers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary, and were not disappointed. The location was perfect, as we were able to enjoy great dining, shopping, and the theater all within walking distance. We were even able to take BART in, and walk from the station, so as to aviod driving/parking in the city. When we told the staff it was our anniversary, they went out of their way to make it special for us, including giving us a gift of chocolates and a card when we checked out. We'd certainly consider this place again the next time we plan a similar trip.

Reviews.Title: “Many might be familiar with the name, but you will be pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: govtrip
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Nikko of San Francisco was wonderful! Due to an overbooking, due to a conference, I was able to enjoy to services of this hotel. In fact, all 11 of my federal co workers were all pleasantly pleased with their accomdations. The staff was ever so friendly and accomodating upon my reasonably short ride from the airport, the rooms were clean and comfortable - modern with an asian flair, and the hotel is located near numerous stores and restaurants. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: The Frozen North -- Please Help Us!
Reviews.Title: “Great choice near union square area”
Reviews.Author: KW_Cpl
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week for a conference, plus a weekend of leisure time. Hadn't stayed at Nikko in a decade but was pleasantly surprised. Booked a queen room but got a king (well worth the upgrade if they offer it to you for a nominal fee), on the 18th floor with a nice view and a huge, well appointed bathroom with a shower and separate soaking tub. The hotel was visually attractive and immaculate, the staff were all unfailingly pleasant, the location was great and I felt the value was good compared to other choices in the neighborhood. I would not hesitate to book this again. We enjoyed the bar's (1/2 price wine) happy hour and great service from bartender Spencer. Bonus points: The front desk manager sent up a bottle of champagne upon learning (not from me but a family member sending a gift certificate) that it was my birthday. Very much appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location - perfect for my business”
Reviews.Author: TADT
Reviews.Content: I was in SF for a business meeting (conference held in Hilton hotel, on the other side of the street) so the location of this hotel was great for me: not only two minutes away from the conference I had to attend, but also very close to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “A favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dealette
Reviews.Content: A hotel that makes you feel special while allowing anonymity.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel and its central location!”
Reviews.Author: wwdakota1
Reviews.Content: The Nikko was quiet, beautiful and comfortable PLUS it was so close to Union Square. I loved it. Attention to detail in both the room, lobby, elevators and most of all the staff were so very pleasing . . . and it didn't hurt to have a Starbucks for those of us who were up before 6am. I'd stay here again in a New York minute.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: LGdeR
Reviews.Content: After spending three quiet nights at an inn in Napa Valley, we reached San Francisco where we were able to experience its diversity, sophistication and endless commotion amongst visitors and locals. The Nikko Hotel, perfectly situated in the prime area of Union Square enabled us, within walking distance, to enjoy the finest restaurants, museums (San Francisco Museum of Modern Art is a must) and shops. Also in walking distance, hopping in the traditional cable car to China Town and FishermanÂ´s Warf. Most of public transportation converges in this area and it is the most inexpensive and the fastest way to move around SF. The Nikko Hotel, really puts attention to details. With its minimalistic ambiance and decor, creates a very soothing and relaxing atmosphere that can be perceived the moment you walk in. The services are at the highest levels. The personnel, not only friendly but highly trained and as professional as they could be, ready to accommodate all your needs. The rooms with more technology than you may need in a leisure trip, but is nice to have them in case of a business trip. Pricewise, the most affordable among the hotels of the same level.

Reviews.Title: “It was a memorable trip we really enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: KTMuggy
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to San Francisco several times in the past and always have a great time, stayed at the Drake last trip and wasn't all that impressed. Let me tell you though, location means everything. The Nikko is situated right in the heart of it all, and talk about a view. We have a room on the 21st floor facing Macy's. It was great. The hotel is very classy and nicely decorated, very contemporary. We ate at the restaurant Anzu two nights in a row. It was the best sushi I have ever eaten....fresh, fresh... it was extraordinary. Our server/bartender Mami was amazing, talk about a multi-tasker. She had the nicest personality and was so effiecient. Thank you so much Mami for making our dining and cocktail experience fantastic!! You are great. The rooms are nice; however, showing a little bit of age. I would like to see a slight improvement in that area only. Beds are very very comfortable and bathrooms are nicely done. The Nikko is very well managed. I had the pleasure of meeting and conversing with Anna Marie Presutti. the General Manager. Anna Marie, I have to tell you --you are doing a fantastic job! The place is lovely, the staff is exceptional. I won't hesitate to return to the Nikko and tell all of my friends and business contacts what a lovely hotel the NIkko continues to be after all these years. Great job Nikko!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: reba1007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful and in a great location to union square, market street, trolley car and muni transportation. Agree with a previous reviewer on the street noise, but I think that goes along with staying in a big city. The best part of this hotel was the FRONT DESK. Always courteous and helpful with a big smile. Excellent, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for convention, cable car, and BART”
Reviews.Author: Deck314
Reviews.Content: I took the BART from SFO and the Hotel Nikko was a very short walk from the Powell Street station. It is also within walking distance to great shopping as well as the cable car to either Fisherman's Wharf or Ghiradelli Square. The room was nicely appointed, but I found the bed slightly soft for my taste. Not a show-stopper, but a firmer mattress would have been better. The bed is very "Westin-like," with an ample amount of pillows. I was on the 15th floor, but the AM traffic noise in downtown SF was still audible. There is likely no hotel in this area that would be truly quiet in the morning, but the automotive cacophony was memorable. The hotel restaurant is first rate, with a wonderful American/Japanese buffet each morning. Concierge services were quite helpful and offer full service. I didn't visit the Razz Room, but it regularly books first class entertainment, so will have to go back to catch a show. All in all, a very nice hotel--recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fine overall ...could have better windows to reduce outside noise”
Reviews.Author: snod73
Reviews.Content: Staying here right now Couldn't sleep well two nights. The windows don't block all outside noise. Today I moved to a higher floor. Still can hear the noise. Unfortunately they cannot move me elsewhere because they don't have the same type of room. Paid good money for this one though Staff are very friendly. Rooms are nice and clean. I have a petite queen size room. Its really petite!!! Did not try restaurant or the lounge. Nice location Overall its a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “All you could ask a hotel to be.”
Reviews.Author: onerandomguy
Reviews.Content: This by far is one of my favorite hotels now. Cleaninliness is always first on my list, and this place is spotless. Beds are super comfy, huge tv, bath was impeccable and the showerheads soothing. Geez I sound like a commercial. Food is not cheap but is top notch. I would recommend taking the upgrde to the imperial room. Once you do the math you will realize that you save money that way. We stayed for 4 nights. Did not have a car.... There was no need.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money spent”
Reviews.Author: jamie_o2
Reviews.Content: My husband, 10 year old son and I were travelling for personal reasons and wanted a nice hotel where our son could use the pool, where we could relax, wander the streets if we wanted and use as a central location for exploring...I have to say I was disappointed on many levels. Everything was an add-on/extra cost. Want to use the pool, it costs. Want wi-fi, it cost; parking wasn't expected free, but then there was more tax on top of that...want to use the restaurant, too late; want to go to a show - 2 drink min....oh, and if you book the room using priceline - beware - they give you the smallest room for what you bid on - want 2 double beds - extra....and the rooms are small and nothing special and frankly, I found to be a bit worn for the amount we were spending....wouldn't stay again with all the hotels in a similar price range....

Reviews.Title: “Modern, well-run hotel in Union Square area”
Reviews.Author: carmeltravler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a conference but came early to sight-see in San Francisco. The room was modern, clean and quiet. The restaurant had an excellent American and Japanese buffet or you could order ala carte; the room is very nice and service very efficient and politeThis is an excellent upscale hotel in the Union Square area. Room rates are reasonable, although parking is as exorbitant as everywhere else in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “I LEFT MY HEART IN SAN FRANCISCO”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne93010
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day trip to San Francisco. We usually stay at the Fairmont and we have stayed in the Wharf area a couple of times. We live in Laguna Beach so we go to San Francisco often. This is probably our 40th trip. The location of the hotel cannot be beat if you like shopping. The hotel is two blocks from Macy's, Cable Car, Westfield Shopping Center and high end shopping around Union Square. The hotel is extremely quiet and clean. You never wait for an elevator and they are not the small ones in boutique hotels that take forever. From the airport we took the Super Shuttle for $17 each. One can take a cab if they prefer. I highly recommend this hotel for comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Needs refurbishment.”
Reviews.Author: UniTra
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for three nights. I chose it because of the great location, a couple of blocks from Union Square. Very handy for shopping. Lots of restaurants in the neighbouring streets, plus a Starbucks next to the lobby. I had a Deluxe room on a higher floor, so just enough to give a view. The room was of average size and was clean. I didn't use many services at the hotel so I can't comment extensively, but the limited interaction I had with staff (e.g. valet parking, front desk) was quick and efficient. The only thing that detracted slightly from my whole experience at this hotel was that the furnishings in the room were showing signs of age, so not quite what one would expect from a hotel of this class. I think the rooms are overdue for a refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: PlanetR
Reviews.Content: Nikko is a very nice hotel centrally located to public transportation and walk to many places easily. The room was very nice, comfortable beds, large bathroom with separate shower inclosure and bathtub. Wish they had the washlet toilets like in Japan, but otherwise very nice. Plenty of drawer and closet space. Had an inroom safe. The carpet was soiled and needs to be replaced. The blackout shades work great. Room is very quiet from hotel noise, but street noise can be loud. The workout facility is top rate $10 for the whole stay for both myself and spouse. Housekeeping was excellent. Staff was helpful, but everything went smoothly so we never really needed anything extra. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A most pleasant stay -- everytime!”
Reviews.Author: lelannsdad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully located near Union Square but away from most of the bustle. The staff is excellent -- friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms are very clean, well appointed and comfortable. The Anzu is a great restaurant. The gym and pool are marvelous. Just can't say enough good things for this hotel -- it is quite a value for the city.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MJCharleston
Reviews.Content: First the pro's: good location, comfortable bed, well equipped bath; good housekeeping. Now for the con's: shabby soiled carpeting and worn furniture in bedrooms; very feeble water pressure in the shower; nasty odor in the hallways; $10/day fee for pool and/or workout facilities; $7.50 per 15 min use of their computer--these last two items really irked us--we've stayed in hotels far less espensive than this one where these amenities are free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: msgc2010
Reviews.Content: Located right near Union Square which is really ideal for SF. Would stay again because of location, it was clean, bed was comfortable and the room size wasn't an issue for us either. Would only stay if we got it for the same price or less because it needs a renovation/refresh to be charging more sincethe rooms are average looking for a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TanMD
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nikko is a contemporary Asian influenced hotel located 2 blocks from Union Square. It was our second visit, and what we would consider every time we are visiting downtown SF. It is about 4 blocks from the Powell St BART station and convenient to the downtown area. Amenities are superior, from the beds, to the air conditioning, and bath. The gym was large and well equipped. There is a charge to use the gym, which seems to be typical of these kinds of hotels, but I felt that the charge was entirely reasonable. Wifi was available for a charge (a little high, I thought ). The TV was a nice sized flat screen. My conference ended at noon, and they graciously extended my check out time to that time so that I didn't have to do the luggage storage shuffle. The Nikko fits all my requirements for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: californiagal62
Reviews.Content: We came to San Francisco for a Seminar held at the Nikko and I thought the Hotel did a fantastic job. We stayed at Hotel Nikko and our room was modern, comfortable and clean. We had a wonderful weekend and managed to get in some shopping and sight seeing since things were pretty close. Parking is pricey but that's SF!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but watch out for parking”
Reviews.Author: Leprechaun0446
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first stop of our 1 month Honeymoon on the west coast. The hotel was clean and modern and even had a Starbucks in the lobby. It is very close to everything from Union Square to The Westfield Mall and the Cable Cars. We were very surprised that the parking charges are not included in the rate or complimentary to hotel residents or even at a reduced charge and It was just as well we asked about parking charges when we pulled up at the valet because the people at the check in desk didn't advise us of the charges. The first room they put us in the first night was possibly the smallest hotel room I have ever seen.(Smaller than some B&B's I've stayed in) To tired to complain on our first night after travelling from Ireland I went down the next morning. The member of staff at check in was very helpful and got somebody to show me the other rooms available and ungraded us for a cost($10 a night) to a much bigger room. Overall, a good experience even though the parking is expensive ($50 a day inc. tax)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: tripmonkey12
Reviews.Content: Ended up at Hotel Nikko through Hotwire. Was quite pleased with the overall experience. Stayed with my spouse and a one year old. The location was great -- minutes from Union Square, China town, MOMA etc. Despite being close to the center of the city, the rooms was surprisingly quiet. Lady at the front desk put us in a larger room because of our need for a crib. Glad she did because even in the larger room space was at a premium.

Reviews.Title: “Booking a room in this hotel does not mean you will sleep there”
Reviews.Author: shonafruit
Reviews.Content: After staying at the hotel Nikko in Dehli India, I was very much looking forward to staying in this hotel in San Francisco. However 72 hours before we were due to check they thought it was okay to call and downgrade us to a generic downtown hotel in a conference center. The staff were extremely rude and unhelpful. Extremely disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mkjohnson
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service and a fabulous show in the lounge. Really loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A short but wonderful stay at the Hotel Nikko”
Reviews.Author: ssn0202
Reviews.Content: A beautiful contemporary property with no real negatives. We were provided a spacious room with two queen beds on one of the Nikko Floors. Rooms are very nicely appointed with very comfortable furnishings and a wonderfully outfitted bathroom. All the amenities were included in the room such as a large flat panel TV, free wireless internet, refrigerator and safe. The hotel is a block away from Powell Street so a short walk and you can catch the Cable Car to Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street, Chinatown, etc. Also a very short walk to Union Square if you're into shopping. We had breakfast an Anzu, their restaurant on the second floor. A wonderful menu selection as well as a buffet option. Prices were reasonable for the locale. The only negative I would mention is the cost for parking, which was $50 per night. The next time I visit, I would ditch the rental car since you don't really need one in the city anyway. Overall an excellent stay at the Hotel Nikko, we highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky and great location”
Reviews.Author: emmyw1987
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Nikko, the rooms are a bit small but the view was amazing! The decoration is modern and fashionable. We also really enjoyed its location since it is only a block from Union Square and great shopping. The restaurant there has really good sushi but it is expensive. I would certainly go back but I would definitely shop around for good rates as we did this time!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: john37682
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five days at the Nikko and enjoyed ever minute. The staff exceeded my expectations and the hotel was very nice. The location was close to everything, shopping, resturarants, bars, and the cable cars. The pool and hot tub were a nice touch and was not crowed at all. I would highly recommend this to singles and families alike.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Tnspro1
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in San Francisco many times over the past 28 years and this the nicest hotel we've found. Everything was excellent - the bedroom, the bathroom and the service. We stayed on the executive level and the wine and cheese was a welcome break in the afternoon. The breakfast in the restaurant was outstanding. It was out anniversary and my husband ordered flowers for me, which were waiting in the room when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaxxxxy
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for its location, workout room and the pool. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The rooms were a little small, but bathrooms were spacious enough for two adults without tripping over each other. The restaurant Anzu was ok. We had breakfast buffet and did sushi dinner one night. The sushi was delicious but had to get permission to order off the of the dedicated sushi menu in the dining room and not at the sushi counter. It felt a little cafeteria like I am sorry to say. The bar area was cool and chic looking and again the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: Vicster8
Reviews.Content: My husband (and business partner) stayed here for 7 nights on a dual business and leisure trip. We couldn't fault the hotel. Lovely rooms, great beds, great breakfast, helpful staff. We paid extra to stay in an Imperial Floor room - well worth it as breakfast and broadband connection are included. The breakfasts were delicious and the serving staff were helpful and remembered us from day to day - not something you expect at a Union Square hotel. The rooms were generous and the range of pillows available excellent (we are both fussy sleepers). The ground floor bar is also a great spot to unwind after a day of meetings/shopping. I thoroughly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Conference”
Reviews.Author: anccarter
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice. Comfortable Rooms. Good room tempterature controls

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nikko is a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Lamab85704
Reviews.Content: I stay here once per week on business. The service is wonderful. The employees remember your name and they go that extra mile to ensure that your stay is an enjoyable one. I highly recommend this hotel when stating in downtown SF.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL - 0 STARS”
Reviews.Author: Percy-Penguin
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my husband for a 3 night stay. Upon check-in I asked for a quiet room as I explained we were on our honeymoon and were tired from travelling. We had booked a deluxe king room in about February using Expedia. Upon check in we were told that the hotel was fully booked (it was a Monday) and that they could only accommodate us in a queen standard room. We then very firmly stated that this was simply not good enough as we had pre-booked our room, were on our honeymoon and to give us less than what we had booked was less than what we had paid for and was misleading and deceptive. We then (at our initiative) had to haggle with the receptionist (who was incredibly incompetent, unfriendly and really needed to improve her people skills) to try and be compensated for taking the inferior, much smaller and cheaper room. We asked for continental breakfast each morning, wi-fi and use of the gym and pool (which quiet frankly should be included anyway) but no she simply could not give us all of that. She couldn't even guarantee that if we took the queen standard room for one night we could be moved to the deluxe king room for the 2 remaining nights. After arguing with her for about 15 minutes and standing our ground to say that we wanted the room which we had booked 7 months ago and paid for, and wanted to speak to the hotel general manager (who we were told was not available) we eventually got it. She told us that a VIP would have to be moved from that room. We did get one morning's free breakfast to 'compensate' us and use of the hotel's wine and cheese sundowner (which was pathetic to say the least) - which was big of them. Upon checking in to our room we were extremely disappointed. Gee I felt sorry for any 'VIP' staying there. Whilst clean the rooms are extremely small and dated. Having 3 suitcases, 1 carry on, 1 back pack and a piece of art we struggled to fit into the room comfortably. Lucky we didn't take the standard queen room otherwise our bags would have been in the hall way. After paying for wi-fi we checked out the Expedia website. There were rooms still available for the dates of our stay (including king deluxe rooms). We stayed at 8 American hotels during our honeymoon and this was by far the worst. We booked all our accommodation for our trip using Expedia and did not encounter any problems at all except for the Hotel Nikko. The only decent thing about this hotel is its close proximity to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, splendid service and ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: GertFrobe
Reviews.Content: We decided on a family room for our 3 day stay in SF. The staff at the reception desk were very friendly and service minded. The room was a bit to small for a family travelling with two teenagers. High up there was still some noice from the streets. Location was perfect though it was quite a stretch to the piers. Very nice fitnes center and pool!

Reviews.Title: “I can say it in one word: "Fantabulous"!”
Reviews.Author: DOWHATITELLU
Reviews.Content: Stay on the imperial floor. The perks are Excellent. The beds are beyond comfortable, the view is great and the room was very clean. We asked for a refrigerator and it was there when we arrived. The exercise services were wonderful if you like steam/dry sauna experience as well as swimming and exercise equipment. In the Anzu restaurant the buffet brunch was fabulous. The afternoon 5 to 7 free coctails and snacks was absolutely the best. The Rrazz room bar was cozy. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful. The location to everything was wonderful (walk to BART, cable car, shopping, restaurants, etc...). We could not have picked a better place to stay. We had the best time and felt spoiled. We will definitely book again and look for other hotel Nikko's in our travels.

Reviews.Title: “I ALWAYS LOOK FORWARD TO MY STAY AT THIS HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: wil3145
Reviews.Content: the breakfast buffet is excellent and one of the reason we like to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “One of best hotels we've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Gill46Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of hotel! We stayed here for 3 nights during a short visit to San Francisco and got a special rate through expedia. The room was a good size, amenities and public areas were excellent and staff very friendly and eager to help The fitness and pool area was one of the best we've seen for a hotel, and was never over-busy. The location of the hotel is fantastic, with Union Square being only a few minutes walk away. Overall, terrific value for money for a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “12 day stay”
Reviews.Author: MeterReader
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very helpful staff, great room. Very nice pool and excerise room. Watch where you walk, the wrong direction can put into a neighborhood you will not like, but not a big problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay....everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: heuster
Reviews.Content: I planned one last trip before going to work. Coming off my European trip, I wanted to go somewhere similar and San Francisco is the closest city to Paris or London. I searched and looked at many properties and didn't even consider here until it popped up in a search. It was a very wise choice! I suggest booking through the website because they usually have some good deals. I also suggest corresponding with the reservation office too, because if there is a problem, you have someone to contact. I highly recommend the Imperial Club rooms. They are a little bit more, but after what we paid in London, it was pretty reasonable. They put us on the 24th floor, and you need to use your room card to get there...a nice touch. Comfy beds and a view of a part of the city, Union Square and other buildings. Two things I loved about this room (2409), the tv in the mirror in the bathroom, and the long hallway from the door to inside. We stayed for 4 nights and didn't hear anyone, and it was a full house that weekend. There's an in-room safe and a bar set up. It would be great if there was a separate area in the fridge for your own drinks/water. We also had a nightly turndown which we were unaware of, but chocolates on one night and green tea mints on another, were pretty cool. They have the largest workout facility I've ever seen in a hotel. Didn't use the indoor pool or jacuzzi, but probably would've if we had the time. The 5-7 evening reception was great except for one evening when there were children present. I understand why, but maybe allow them in during the second hour so those of us don't have to listen to a crying child. The breakfast buffet was simple yet satisfying. The restaurant was never overly crowded. The staff was very pleasant. The rate I paid included the breakfast and WiFi. Never used the concierge because it's much more fun to explore and discover. Not a big fan, but the Starbucks came in handy. If you decide to stay here, the Imperial floors are the way to go. The rooms are spacious. It might be a bit more, but it's a small price to pay for comfort and less stress. Some of the furniture shows a little wear and tear. The front desk staff was very professional and even let us check out an hour later, even though they were booked, so we didn't have to wait around to leave. The location was great! Within walking distance of Union Square but away from most major noise. If you book through a 2nd party, you really don't want to stay here, so don't. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value, great views, wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: muralpainter37
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for two nights at Hotel Nikko through Travelzoo. Our room was on the 14th floor with a corner view of downtown SF that was fab! The room and bath were nicely appointed in modern decor with a Japanese flair. The staff made us feel welcomed and wanted from the time we booked the room through varoius emails through the duration of our stay. This truly is a 4-star hotel in every way. Parking at the hotel is expensive, but there is public parking over about 1 block for $25/night. We highly recommend it to anyone visiting San Francisco, whehter it's your first time or not.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Central and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: levijaya
Reviews.Content: Booked two inter-connecting rooms with less than 24 hours notice - we arrived from HK and I had 'forgotten' about the international date line, and our house we rented was not ready for 24 h ours! Rang them direct from HK and asked to be put through to Front Desk. Anyone with young children will appreciate how hard it is to get inter-connecting rooms confirmed. This was 6th call to a hotel in SF. Fantastic girl on reception who checked, moved some people around, checked again and then confirmed immediately. Standard rooms but inter-connecting for better price than I had found on-line. Pool is NOTHING special - liners always make me shudder and it was so full it was hard to play/swim. Location wonderful and all staff friendly and approachable. Did not eat there so cannot comment on food. Only 'nightmare' was going to bed at 8.30pm having arrived from Hong Kong, only to be awoken at 9.00pm by a voice telling us to evacuate immediately. Had to do so and stood shivering on street for 20 minutes with no guidance from anyone. Apparently false alarm but was unimpressed at a) lack of apology, b) mostly that not one member of staff appeared at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: suebhon
Reviews.Content: My family of four (husband and 11-year old twin girls) stayed at the Nikko for 4 nights. I had booked an Imperial floor room with two queen beds both for the space and the amenities. Had read reviews about tiny rooms, etc. When we arrived we were offered an upgrade to Imperial Executive Suite for an additional $50 a night. We went for it and were glad we did. The Imperial Executive Suite on the 22nd floor had big windows with a nice view, two queen beds in the bedroom, a living area separated by a partial wall, a large bathroom, a half bath, two televisions, hallway... not huge but lots of space. Beds were very comfortable with lovely bedding, bathrooms were great-- Furniture was otherwise a bit tired as was the carpet. But the room was perfect for us and very, very quiet. We slept really well-- not a sound from the hall or from other rooms. We really like the included buffet breakfast at ANZU --since we had coupons for two people for each day, we had breakfast there twice with all four of us. The other two days we had nice continental breakfast in the Imperial Lounge which was also included. We enjoyed the 5-7pm wine and hors d'ouevres in the Imperial Lounge. And we especially loved the large indoor pool, hot tub and locker rooms with saunas and steam rooms. This, along with free wi-fi was all part of the Imperial package. Our rate wasn't cheap, but nor was it particularly high considering all that was included--We paid around $250 a night. A splurge for us, but worth it particularly given the reviews for other rooms in the hotel. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel Nikko SF”
Reviews.Author: HershieK
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 3 nights in an executive suite. The bathroom was huge and gorgeous with a deep tub and separate shower, tv built into the mirror and plenty of floor space! The room had a corner view and a very comfortable king size bed with wi-fi included in the price of a suite room and a large flat screen tv. The suite had a seperate queen sleeper sofa which I admit was nothing but wire coils and not comfortable for my teen so we had a twin size roll away brought up for a one time fee of $30.00 (some hotels charge nitely) the kids also had a half bath which helped with privacy. We really enjoyed using the fitness center and the hotel has a contemporary, urban vibe to it's decor. My teens ate at the hotel breakfast buffet which they loved and my husband and I just went downstairs for a Starbucks every morning that is on a corner adjacent to the hotel. Valet was expensive but friendly and efficient staff. The second night I kept hearing noise from the street at 11 pm (LOUD NOISE) and I was on the 18th floor! After an hour I called the front desk to find out the situation and the city was digging up part of the road downtown with jackhammers, beeping trucks, etc., until 4 am!! The hotel manager (Sue?) was very gracious and offered to move us that night or the next morning to an upgraded suite. We did move in the morning and went to the 24th floor Imperial Suite which is when things changed. This room was nothing like the Executive wuite we came from. The bathroom was dated and the grout was coming out from the tiles, the carpet was stained and the sheers on the windows looked as if someone had taken a knife to them and slashed them all the way down. The room had a musty old smell to it and the windows had a problem with fog and moisture. I appreciate the offer but quite frankly, I missed my previous room and would have gladly moved back if I hadn't had two teens who were so excited about their "separate quarters", I decided to just stay with it for one night but I was glad that I had not spent the extra money for an Imperial Suite, maybe they just haven't remodeled that far up yet or maybe it is a room they give to people to make them feel better when moved to an "upgraded" room. I did not appreciate it at all!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Hotel Nikko San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: scalderusa
Reviews.Content: We paid $175 per night via Priceline.com, which was a massive rip-off! This hotel would barely deserve a 3 star rating (at best): the room was tiny (8 feet across), the shower dribbled water (no water pressure), and the location is sketchy. Avoid it and for sure don't use Priceline because you don't know what you are going to get!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, adequate rooms. A little expensive and no free wifi???”
Reviews.Author: missjaynel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nikko is in a good location, close to restaurants, shopping and tourist attractions and the rooms are small, clean and adequate. The rooms were a little expensive and the fact that there is no free wi-fi was unusual. The concierges were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Good, A Few Gripes”
Reviews.Author: RebroperSyndicate
Reviews.Content: We booked here largely because we were travelling with relatively short notice, and got a reasonable deal via priceline (but not the kind where you have no idea where you'll be staying). It's a nice hotel for the most part, with good in-room amenities and well kept. The location is pretty good, if touristy and somewhat close to the tenderloin. Our room had an in-room fridge acting as a mini-bar and there was a sign on it offering to empty it so you could use it yourself. I called and instead of emptying it (which is a hassle, I guess), they brought an extra bar fridge free of charge. On the negative side, they wanted $15 a day for WiFi, which struck me as excessive. I'll hold my nose and pay $10, but $15 felt like gouging to me. I don't know if it's $15 per wireless device, but I suspect it might be â€” WiFi was your only option, no wired Internet (which I prefer if I have to pay). Also, one morning I asked went to the concierge desk to ask about good places for breakfast. The woman there was on the phone, but gave me a quizzical â€œCan I help you?â€� expression, so I asked my question, but without saying anything at all in response, she just turned away and continued talking on the phone acting as if I wasn't there at all. After a few minutes of standing there like a lemon, I walked away, annoyed. Sadly that one instance of rude treatment at the hotel is what sticks in my mind. So, it was okay, and I wouldn't object to being made to stay there again, but next time I'll probably try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Take care with your reservation....they dangerous!"”
Reviews.Author: MMatos
Reviews.Content: This happen to me: 1. booking and pay (5 nights = 750 euros) in this hotel in May. 2010; 2. Confirme the reserve and everything is ok; 3. leaving home (in Portugal) at 30.july.2010 at 2h; 4. Arrive in San Francisco, USA at 22h30m; 5. In the reception of the hotel, the manager said to you "your reserve is canceled" and you mut go to another hotel...we are in overbooking. Night Manager Romeo and the day manager Ms Anne Estiva did not help us to find a room...We have to complain; phone to Portugal to prove the payment...and they did not care about us....horrivel experience. Take care with them. During long hours of complain...we saw several people complain about the beds; the service; the $200 charge of the credit card;....and ...the bills...take care....they will not help you. It is true that the hotel is very big, lots of rooms, central location...and after three days of complains...we finally get out rooms...said history.jbbhbbu gg

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mozart59
Reviews.Content: Location one block from Union Square, perfect. We had two Imperial Club rooms which included a fantastic continental breakfast and wine beer & soft drinks with canapes 5pm - 7pm. The room my 16 & 13 year old sons shared was like a small apartment. Two queen beds. Flat screen TV's, wireless in-room internet, free access to great gym and pool. Access to the club lounge with TV & computers was fantastic. All staff were very helpful and polite. They allowed us to keep one room until 2pm as we had a late flight. Only two minor complaints. The carpet in my room two large stains on it and the A/C was a little noisy. I would stay here again a will definitely recommend it to anyone I know traveling to S.F. It is well wroth paying the extra to stay on the Imperial Club Floors.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: sleepi321
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July. The hotel is in a good central location, within walking distance to union square, from where we could get onto the hop on hop-off tour bus. Staff were very courteous and helpful. The lady at the concierge recommended a wonderful seafood restaurant and booked a table for us. The bathroom was big and the Gilchrist and Soames products were a nice touch. The hotel itself is very quiet. Although we were warned that the local area can become a bit shady at night, we didn't have any issues at all. However, since we were told to stay on the cautious side, I'd recommend others do too. I would definitely stay in this hotel again. It's a wonderful base to explore San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Did I stay at the same hotel as other reviewers?”
Reviews.Author: trexville
